I find myself on a beautiful beach. I see a campfire and some dancing figures in the distance. I run towards them, hoping to make new friends and explore the world together.

I approach them, cautiously. My time in DayZ has left me a little gun-shy in these survival games. They spammed a few wave emotes, so I came in closer and thought I'd join them.

Queue Admiral Ackbar, IT'S A TRAP!" One of them tossed several spears into my chest while the other clubbed me into submission.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Joins server
-Meets random guy in iron armor
-We dance
-He ties me up and drags me to his house
-He keeps me in a cage for almost an hour
-He occasionally lets me out to dance
-He keeps me fed and hydrated
-He calls me his dancing slave and starts to whip me
-He demands that I dance for him while he mines
-He turns away for a brief second and I run for my life
-I successfully escape
-I see the Kings castle and begin my journey
-I arrive at the castle and ask the King for assistance
-He says he will grant me protection and gives me a bodyguard
-I kill the bodyguard and take his gear
-I use my newfound power to hunt down my former owner
-I eventually find and kill my oppressor
-I make my way back to the King to tell him of my victory
-I earn the Kings trust
-We grow close
-I kill the King and take his place on the throne
-Nobody f*@#ks with me ever again
-I am the dancing King

12/4 - IGN

*IMPORTANT INFO*
I only played the game once
I was only in one server
There are pictures of this on my profile if you dont believe me

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI know what you're asking yourself: Is this game worth the $20 gamble?" At the current state of this game
date: I'm going to have to say no. No
recommended: you should not buy this game
hoursPlayed: and here's a short explanation why you shouldn't.\n\nFirst
voteText: let me clarify that I'm not some squeaker that bought this game last week with daddy's credit card. I've played this game since alpha 5. I've witnessed the rise and fall of trolling hackers with admin-like abilities
helpfulPercent:
and I remember the beginning of the Asian Invasion of torch jumpers. I've played/enjoyed/wasted over 1000 hours on this game.

Reasons Why You Shouldn't Purchase This Game:

1. Scenario: You play the game for 4 hours building a modest base with sound security. You log for the evening. The next day
votesHelpful: you find that you are dead and your base is completely gone. You deduce that your base was raided while you were offline. You are angry
votesTotal: but you decide to build another base. The previous scenario happens another 3 or 4 times over the next week. Base building starts to seem trivial.\n\nThe Devs solution to this problem is some sort of totem system that protects your crest and a small portion of your base while you are offline. That's almost akin to putting a bandaid on a broken leg. The problem lies with who is playing on the server
votesFunny: and by who
commentsCount: I mean region or more specifically
column17: if people from a completely different time zone (think China) play on a North American server consistently
column18: the vast majority of people will be offline when the vast majority of the opposing time zone(r)s are on. This creates a raid imbalance of sorts. The solution would be region locking the serves. The Devs are trying to solve this is a round about way by booting people with high pings
column19: but i'm sure there will be ways around that which leads me to my next point.\n\n2. Combat System: If you and the person you are fighting have a ping of 100ms or less
column20: PvP is quite enjoyable. But
column21: if you're fighting someone with a 200ms + ping (and yes this happens on a daily basis - that whole region thing again)
column22: the player with the high ping has a great advantage over you. Imagine getting headshot from 20 meters away.\n\n3. Seige Equipment: At this point
column23: siege equipment no longer seems balanced. An average person with a trebuchet can destroy a decent base with thick walls in about 5 minutes. There was a time when a good castle could last a week or maybe 2. Nowadays
column24: a castle usually doesn't survive one siege attempt.\n\n4. Player Base: Any way you cut it
column25: the player base is shrinking. Thus
column26: servers have been shutdown. If seems that if this trend continues
column27: this game will not survive. I'm not sure if it will make it our of early access.\n\nDevs
column29: shields and bucklers will not protect us from hacks or lagging players from other regions. That is what is choking your game. Wake up before RoK is DoA.\n\n"

reviewText:
362.7 Hours into the game and I will say that I love it. It's great. I love building things, I love raiding, I love fighting in PvP. The game has a long way to go but it's a blast.

HOWEVER.

This game is plagued by hackers. A problem that their Anti Cheat does not help with, nor do the developers really seem to care about the hacking problem.

One day I was in my base organizing my resources and I hear my chests opening, it was just me in my base, I saw nobody. So I knew something was wrong, I check my chests...and they are all EMPTY. Next thing I know, I was insta killed. Everything was taken, and soon after the rest of the server was crying out that a hacker was killing them. All that progress, weeks of progress....lost.

Another instance, is I was farming Iron, a man in full steel tries to kill me though I am much faster since I am naked and I actually got away. I was watching him though and I see him stop running, a few seconds after he stopped running I dropped dead and he proceeded to my dead body and looted my resources. Another isnta death.

The hackers ruin the game, therefore I would not recommend this game in its current state UNLESS you plan on paying for your own server, which you shouldn't have to do to enjoy this game.

You will lose hours and hours of progress to someone using a cheat and typing in an admin command that they should not have any access to, all in just a few seconds.

I hope one day I can come back to this game, and maybe when the game isn't plagued with hacks and exploits I will recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of Griefers and Hackers

When I first saw the trailers for this game I thought it looked amazing. An island with a throne. An objective of becoming the King. What I expected was a Game of Thrones with guilds of players working together to capture territory and to install their leader as King. Backstabbing and intrigue. And lone wolfs just trying to survive amidst it all. What I actually got was Lord of the Flies reenacted by the inmates of Aylesbury Young Offenders Institute.

I started off, found some abandoned half destroyed ruin in a forest at the edge of the island and started building it up. Repaired the walls. Built new facilities inside. Got killed finding resources but I learned from it. Built iron doors. Built a stone outer wall. Things were going great!

You use crests to mark territory, and I had a basic leather one in my base. This makes it so players cannot remove blocks from your house so if they want in they have to force entry.

I had acquired the resources for an iron one which marks a wider amount of space so I could have a big thick stone wall around my base for protection. Unfortunately you can only have 1 crest at a time even if it's in your own territory so to replace the crest I had to remove my previous one and place a new one, accepting 10 minutes of complete vulnerability until it remarked the territory.

So I remove my crest and put the new iron one down. At that moment 10 (not kidding) japanese players in iron armour came storming over, tore down my walls and took my items while I hid in my panic room. Stepping out I noticed the devestation and ina fury ran out in my steel armour with ym steel greatsword. Naturally this didn't end well for me

I was then informed that these people are hackers who ruin the game for everyone and scrolling down through the reviews I noticed that this is a common problem.

You know, up until that point I would have given this game another glowing review. But the destruction of hours and hours of my hard work have left me in an understandably bitter mood and the developers attitude towards the hacking problem doesn't help.

So 8/10 before the hack and 0/10 post-hack due to the game being unplayable. DO NOT BUY!

Edit: Against my better judgement I decided to give this game another try. Spent hours building a new base and then a new patch was released, wiping the servers and destroying my work. So I spent many more hours building another base, had to answer the phone while I was out finding resources and since your character goes to sleep in the game when you log out I logged back in to find I had been killed while I was away having a life. Got back to my base to find 2 lovely chaps had not only taken over my base but had also built a prison outside and put someone in it. Now my base was made out of wood with a top tier iron door outside. For a new player with limited access to resources (and since the stone quarry is swarming with heavily armed players looking for newbies to kill) this is basically the best I could achieve. I even put my crest inside the walls so they would have to tear them down to find it if they wanted to take over. Naturally this didn't stop these 2, whether it was hacks or high level equipment they somehow got in, found and destroyed my crest. Since the walls seemed intact they either rebuilt them exactly or they simply hacked it, most likely the latter.

Tried to force entry into my own home and they both came out. My attacks passed through them doing no damage and eventually I died. Please for the love of god DON'T GET THIS GAME!!!

Final Edit:

So after I pulled myself together I decided to give it one final try with two objectives, retake my base and be crowned as Queen!

I made a new base nearby my old one, gathered my power there then forced entry and retook it, leaving the miserable gits who took it handcuffed and sealed in a cobblestone box.

With that unpleasantness out of the way I turned my attention towards the throne at which point the server promptly shut down, one of about 2/3 of all the servers that were shut down!

So I joined another server, built a new base, then when I logged back in later all traces of my base had vanished and I was now playing as a fat bald man....

Sensing a pattern I decided not to bother building anything anymore since between server wipes, game breaking errors, servers shutting down and high level players you are lucky if anything you build lasts a few hours.

Someone had built a cobblestone wall on the bridge to the castle but I was able to get around it by building a skybridge. Passing through there I was immediately ganged up on and killed by 2 steel clad people. The only other 2 people on the server. Apparently they just wait there with the patience of the ancients for someone to log in, get through or around their stone wall, and then get killed by them both.

So I jumped servers and found a castle with a massive wall on it and a lot of player activity. I decided to get around this by gathering many cheap blocks and building a staircase behind the castle up to the top, no mean feat since the rock the castle stands on must be about 200 blocks tall! Fortunately I didn't need to waste much time on this because I ran into a bug where every approx 5 minutes my screen goes black forcing me to log out and in again, and if I was in the sea I drop to 40 fathoms below it and drown before I can get back up again

Next server had nothing on the bridge but a couple of steel clad foul mouthed kiddies. After getting massacred the first time I came up with a plan. I made a bed and ran past them, placed it down behind a rock then did an Obi Wan and lowered my club as they slaughtered me with cries of noob and nigerian.

So they ran off back to the front of the bridge to await their next victim while I respawned at the bed. I then spent 45 minutes clubbing my way through the wooden wall they had built to block entrance to the castle and seized the throne before they could get back to stop me! At that moment I felt something like overcoming an especially tough boss in Dark Souls!

I think I know now why the game ended up so far from it's vision. The game trailers give a fair amount of attention to the presences of ropes, shackles, cages and torture devices, which are clearly present for the sake of bullying and griefing. Of course these things do exist in the Medieval era and I gave it little thought. But when a bully watches that trailer they will be drawn to the game by the promise of these griefing tools.

In practice they lack the patience to craft the necessary facilities to produce these things, and simply travel in gangs attacking lone players and destroying their work with their clubs. What's more the game artwork displays caracatures of bloated troll like men acting like monkeys and the in-game character customisation option not only allows for exaggerated anatomy, but the pvp meta is of a pitch black midget with maximum size arms for the smallest target to hit with the longest reach. In the end the game advertising appeals to exactly these sorts of people who drive away everyone else and leave the community a toxic cesspool.

So I suppose in the end this game is like Dark Souls meets Lord of the Flies, except the hollows are obscenity spewing bullying ganging adolescents, and the bosses are server wipes, servers closing and game breaking bugs. That all said, I'm glad I can finally uninstall this ordeal with peace of mind that I didn't let it break me :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day 1. Spawned in, chopped up some sleeping guy on a beach, got full steel amour and a steel sword. went and killed a helpless moose, logged off in a bush.
Day 2. Spawned back in after a nice poo, spawned in dead. Some little freak killed me in my sleep... I then logged off for the day enraged.
Day 3. Came on a lovely populated server with some nice thoughts of my life, met some nice young lads who invited me to their guild, after hours of fun, they enslaved me and threw me in a cage (I felt heartbroken)
Then 3 or more people come running down from the hills screaming 'Allah Akbar'. I don't even know what that means, but they killed the people who enslaved me, and then roped me up and took me for a walk.
After they got to their base, they asked if I would like to join them, I had slight trust issues at that time, but I decided to listen. We got along quite nicely, and killed some randoms for fun! So that concluded my day, so I logged off.
Day 4. Spawned in with a giant hole in our base and 5 of the members repairing it, apparently a 'Treb' blew a hole in the wall, but my mates killed them all, which I missed the action... sadly. We then went to pay the king a visit, the King, Unknowingly, placed a bounty on our guilds heads, and the next minuet there were HEAPS of people from EVERY angle shooting rubbish at our base, trebs, balistas, it was fully spooky man. Long story short, we all died.
Day 5. Spawned in, rode a lovely rocking horse, and got roped secretly by a naked man, and thrown off a bridge.

10/10, love the game, would write more, but honestly, no one cares anyways, cheers lads.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Spend 20 hours making kick-♥♥♥ house and expendable goods.
-Now What
-Me and Guild buddy make a small abusement park
-We make a box outside our house
-Ground floor for cage fights.
-Put two cages inside, double iron locked doors, viewing platform
-Walls high enough that people can't get out
-Me and guild-mate go out and shackle one person each, give them an iron sword.
-Put them in cages facing each other in battle arena.
-Bring friendlies over, and we place our bets
-Tell the two people in cages that they're fighting for their freedom
-Release cages at the same time, and watch the two slaves brutally fight for 10 minutes
-My guy wins, get 400 iron ore, 200 oil
-Winning.jpg
-Let guy our of doors
-Tell him to run free
-Starts Running off, give him wood for his trouble.
-Comes back, tries to kill us
-Shackle him again, and hang him from the gallows above the battle arena
-His body is a permanent reminder to others not to escape.
And that's how my guild started an underground fight club.
11/10, would build again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Day 1:
- Created character with similar looks of a Potato
- Named him Spudicus
- Spawned on a beach with nothing but a handy stump and g string to cover my potato parts.
- Started hitting tree for wood but I was captured by naked man with wooden mask.
- Dragged through the ocean and across beaches onto an island and put into a cage.

Day 2:
- Forced to sing songs and play Darude Sandstorm on a flute for the tribal savages.
- Was beaten if I missed a note or skipped one.
- Every now and again they would tie me up and drag me to a pillory and begin whipping me and calling me a dirty spud.
- Soon realising I was slowly dying by starvation since they only fed me water I begged for mercy.

Day 3:
- As the tribal men were off in the woods a tiny skinny black man randomly appeared.
- I instantly got the small black mans attention and began begging for him to let me out.
- As the tiny black man was attempting to break the cage which held me a tribal man came out of no where and began fighting with the tiny black man.
- Tiny black man won the fight with wooden spears and then broke my cage.
- Soon after another tribal man appeared and began to attack us, our tools were unmatched and the tiny black man ran out of spears.

Day 4:
- After running through forrest which seemed like forever I had lost track of the tiny black man and was still being chased by the tribal man.
- Came across a knight in steel wearing a crown and wielding a mighty swirly sword.
- After one blow at the tribal man delivered by this crowned knight the savage was dead, off with his head!
- The knight introducded himself as Werthin the king of the realm.
- I pledged my life for the king and in return would always be by his side until the end.

Day 5:
- King Werthin had made me his royal knight and I shall never leave his side.
- I was given the greatest steel armour and weapons made by the King himself.
- I am now known as Sir Spudicus.

Day 6:
- Together King Werthin and I began fortifying the Ancient Thrown to keep back the relentless savages below.
- After many and endless attacks all attempts to protect the thrown seemed futile.
- The end was near and now myself and King Werthin had many spears embedded into our bodies.

Day 7:
- The raids appeared to have came to a hault for a while however we could see many lights on the bridge heading our way.
- Realising we were running out of bandages I gave my last to King Werthin.
- With the last of my strength I gave one last almighty charge towards the savages.
- Upon my first swing I beheaded one of the savages and cut down another.
- Swing after swing the savages fell upon my blade but one of them got past and through to the King.
- I chased down the savage who had now put King Werthin in ropes and hanged him from the bridge.
- I begged the savages for mercy as they relentlessly attacked me, beating me with their wooden clubs.
- As I watched my King being hung over the ledge I knew my time had come and with one last swing of my sword I beheaded the savage that held my king and plunged over the bridge to my death with the King.

Day 7:
- We survived after smashing against the mountain sides
- Killed one last savage that jumped down after us.
- He had bandages.
- We lived.
- King Werthin however is now Lord Werthin.

11/10 Would kill savages again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With almost 200 hours in game I'll say that the concept is great and very fun at times.  However, unless you are online 24/7 or have an international guild, you cannot maintain a base.  My friends and I have build good multi layered cobblestone+ bases that are completely leveled when we log off and go to sleep.  A steel crest with 6 layers of cobblestone will not prevent it.

The developers need to come up with a solution for the middle of the night base destruction.  For instance, in real life if you were asleep, and someone attacks your base, you'd wake up.  But when you log off the game and go to bed, you're screwed.  There is no balance for this.  It's simply not fun to spend a week gathering stone, iron and wood to build one of the strongest bases in the game just to have it all wiped out because someone else doesn't go to bed the same time you do.

Ideas:

1.  How about Once a person logs off, the block hit-points are incrementally increased by a factor of 120.  Each hour you are offline they decrease by a factor of 5.  So blocks with normal hitpoints of 3000 would have 360,000 for the first hour - 180,000 hit-points 6 hours later and 3,000 hitpoints after 24 hours.  This would help both the legitimate seasoned players as well as the new players defend against griefers and midnight attackers.

2.  Implement a killcam so if your base is leveled in the middle of the night, you can at least see who did it and how they did it.  I have a sneaking suspicion the last base level was not legit and possibly a hack.  My friend said they used gunpowder kegs (which is currently disabled in this version of the game.)  But there's no way to know because there's no telling what happened.  Hint: even in medieval times people would know who leveled a town.  Why not in this game?

So unless you like gathering resources and building bases just to have them destroyed immediately I can't recommend this game in it's current state.

reviewText:
Well now that the games out I will write a review. I had been holding out wanting to see the final vision of this title and as of today here is is.

If you don't want to read; would I recommend this game? No.

Is it a bad game.... well... yes and no.

The game has a very nice concept and that is what attracted me to it in the 1st place. The building is simple (mine craft style), combat can be fun (think chivalry but a dumber version of it) and it looks ok enough for the price.

Problem is the game just feels incomplete. Hackers run rampant across the worlds, combat is buggy at the best of times (hence the “can be fun”), there are many exploits that have been around since the start and it is over all unbalanced.

On a more personal note the development started taking a weird turn towards the last 5 months when they though it was a good idea to add things like fishing and farming to a castle build/siege and sword fighting game. There are many other glaring issues and features that could have been looked at. Also there is no real benefit to doing either of these when you can kill and cook wild animals or just live off berries (which I did constantly).

At the end of the day after the population went from thousands to hundreds they slapped a done badge on it and called it a day. This game could have been good, but fell very short I'm sorry to say.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PROS:

1. When everything is working as it should, the combat is extremely satisfying, especially for us gore lovers. Want to lop off your opponents head? How's about their arms and legs? Even after all that is said and done, anything that they were carrying is now yours for the taking! ( The friends that I do play with have told me this game's combat is similar to that of Chivalry's, so if you like that I'm sure you'll enjoy this )

2. I'm not one for long drawn out executions, but if you are, this game has just about every tool you'll need to make your enemies wish they'd never messed with you! Once you've captured your opponent, you'll have a list of humiliation/torture/execution devices to chose from. From the gallows to the guillotine, you name it, they've got it.

3. Perhaps you want to play some music before battle or just insure that everyone knows of your presence. If so, you should go and craft yourself a long horn, and maybe even a drum or two. That'll keep em on their feet!

4. Although I'm not much into roleplay, you'd have to be blind to not see the amount of potential this game has for it. If you're into rp, you'll find an abundance of community servers just for you.

5. The character creator is incredibly goofy. ( Which isn't a bad thing in this case ) From the tallest, skinniest, big chin...iest person you've ever seen. To the most pregnant, hulkiest, shortest guy you'll never meet. You can really make just about whatever kind of character you want.

CONS:

1. The video shown may include large scale ffa combat, but you'd be hard pressed to find a single situation that doesn't involve a 10v1. ( Unless you're with friends )

2. The combat itself is incredibly inconsistant, especially with the hardcore desync issues that are still present within the game. Even in servers where my ping is below 10, it can get pretty bad. It's basically, Whoever is laggier wins". ( And that's after all of the updates leading up to version 10 )

3. Despite the recent efforts from Code}{atch to stop cheaters from ruining the game
date: they can still be found in just about every server you join. That being said
recommended: there have been several instances of people being banned for using modified dll's.\n\n4. The engine isn't the greatest. ( Or rather; they're use of the engine isn't the greatest ) You'll find people double jumping and sometimes triple jumping directly over your walls. From boosting onto another person's head
hoursPlayed: to making siege workshops and hopping clean over a 15 block high wall. ( Even if they're within your crest's borders )\n\n5. Fighting anywhere near your opponents base is almost always fruitless. If you do any significant amount of damage to them
voteText: they'll simply run into their base and instantly close the door behind them. ( Sometimes having two or more doors in order to trap you inside ) Most recently people have been excluding doors from their builds entirely. Simply removing their own blocks to enter/exit the base
helpfulPercent: then replacing them.\n\n6. The building mechanics can be and most often are
votesHelpful: abused. Have a trebuchet and want to tear down someone's walls? Too bad
votesTotal: they can rebuild everything you've destroyed faster than you can reload. ( Unless you have several people helping you. Even then it's tedious ) Lest you have an unimaginable amount of ammo for your trebuchet
votesFunny: good luck making any progress.\n\n7. This game is riddled with performance issues at the moment. Code}{atch has been releasing updates to try and fix that
column17: \n"hackers"/cheaters
column18: several glitches present in each update ( Often seen in Early Access games )
column19: and in most cases a terrible community ( Based on which server you join )
column20: I'd stay away from this game until it's had some time to progress.\n\nKeep in mind; this review is based on the current state of the game ( Version 10 ) and things are bound to change in the future!"

I have to say im starting to see what those that bought starforge were warning us about, i bought this game almost 1 week ago and i must say i love it. Been running with 5 friends and we're doing well.

And then the hackers hit, Steel crest (prevents others building near your base), 4 thick t6 wall(currently the best wall) that runs 10x18x16 and yet the King and 2 of his men not only get on our roof but into our base which has no entry points (all stairs are bricked off).

But now i realise on almost all occassions we have had the upper hand during combat the server crashes (Widely known to be caused by dupers now)(including when they raided an ally and one of our members snuck up and stole the throne, no suprise server crash).

Im hoping the devs will get into this asap because while one failed start may be accepted by most (Starforge) i guarantee you will be washed up if theres a repeat and no future attempt will get so much as a second glance.

Guess we wait and see if the devs actually bother to do anything about this major game spoiler.

Sad to say but if too much time goes by with no changes consider this game lost all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to put all the developers past issues of other releases aside before I critique this game. I do however recommend you do your research on ANY developer before personally supporting them in an Early Access title. If their past issues put a huge red flag up for you I do not blame you and I recommend you look elsewhere regardless of the games current state.

That being said let's critque the actual current build of the game. I am writing this on 3/11/2015 and have had press access for around a week now.

Crafting: Crafting is really well done and the amount of things you can craft right now is honestly amazing for an early access title. Pretty much everything you see in the world alive/dead can be used for some sort of recipe. There is siege weapons, torture weapons, and a decent selection of major building blocks for castle/house creation. Another HUGE plus is that crafting stations like fireplaces and benches are able to be picked up which makes moving very easy.

The World: Although quite small the world does feel well thought out. There is some absolutely beautiful scenery in this game and I find certain parts of the world hold rarer resources (for example one side of the map may have an abundance of rocks but no flax to be found). I like that it makes moving pretty much needed.

Combat: Having only tested combat once I am definitely not a guru on this subject but it did feel quite decent, latency definitely affects projectiles quite drastically and might be an issue for some people expecting super smooth combat. Overall with melee I had no major complaints but it can be improved.

Building: Building just fine, my only complaint is if you misplace a block theres no delete option and you have to sit there for 5 minutes whacking it to get rid of it so take you time placing them. This would also make rearranging a nightmare.

Politics: Politics atleast right now seem very basic with one king ruler who can impose a tax and claim the land name. You also get a crown and very decent sword. I did not see any way to form a guild so I cannot mention much about that now.

Gathering: Gathering in this game is very well done. Upgraded or gathering-focused weapons yield more per hit and the way trees fall and break is very rewarding, you visually can see how much is left in a resource and it makes gathering kind of enjoyable.

Survival: This is where I think this game went a little wrong. I don't see the need for survival mechanics personally. It is very hard at the start unless you have a good spawn point with an abundance of berries. I would rather see future developement focus on political warfare and creation aspects, I feel survival will feel more like a nuisance than fun for most casual players.

Sever Size: Currently the server size is EXTREMELY small to keep with the map size I assume (I think it's 28 players). This is a huge downside to me, when it comes to medieval warfare you want huge battles with 100's of people. I definitely hope they plan on expanding the map and increasing the server size in the future.

Overall I really enjoyed my time and I think this game had great potential but it's very hard to judge in it's current state how it will play out as a political controlling type game. I do recommend this title but I warn of the risks associtated with this companies past games.

Here are some videos of my experiences if you prefer video format.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xqsZ4rvi-Bo&list=PLEngsjAeWQXh3owPWhvQdpSW77FKQIpfW

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jqKfp2Oul50&list=PLEngsjAeWQXh3owPWhvQdpSW77FKQIpfW

And playlist:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEngsjAeWQXh3owPWhvQdpSW77FKQIpfW

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off, if you're here to read fanny comments that all end in 10/10, stop that. This game is a cruel, cruel mistress. You will spend hours on end making the perfect base, walls, castles, you name it. It will be everything you ever imagined, or maybe even better. All the while you will have scars and experience that will stay with you till death. And despite the hackers, the people basing next to the main resource spawns, and the autists who roleplay and yell at everyone else to roleplay (despite the fact that they build floating bases instead of castles cause they don't wanna get raided) you will ultimately have fun. Should you be playing with friends then there's a good chance that you will become the kingpins of the server. And then, out of the blue, you will raid the wrong group of people, and their one salty friend with hacks will slay everybody on the server hundreds of times, destroy your base, and fly away, without getting banned and with no way to report them because they kept changing their names.

Bottom line is that this game is good. Buggy and filled with hackers, but good. Should they add something like VAC and fix some of the problems then I could see myself coming back to it.

Oh yeah, and you're gonna end up staying up till 3am a lot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How to get support from developers? No way, forget.

Hi, there. My name is Dmitriy and i'm administrator for Reign of Kings Red Sky Server Pack. You can know me or my servers as PUBLIC, DEATHMATCH, RUS RP and others.
We always take 1st places at player count list of community servers.

I started to host our first server at 5th of May and host it till today. Since this time i had problem with voice chat. Every time I tried to talk into a microphone - was a very high chance that the game will throw me from any server in the main menu. The same problem was once next to me says a voice chat someone else.
Of course, I've created a few topics in the discussions which described in detail the problems that arise, but so far no reply has been received. Moreover, so far I have not received a reply on emails sent to e-mail support@codehatch.соm August 8 with a detailed description of several problems and accompanying screenshots. Most of the problems encountered by the players have to deal with the players and OXIDE plugin developers.

The problem of the presence of cheaters detail paint will not, affected only one sentence - there is a problem, and in 3 minutes the presence of cheater on the server, it can cause irreparable damage to the economy or destroy key objects like chests king.

On the problem of serious checks and freezes the game also mention - after 2 weeks of playing on the development, the popular server game world oversaturated blocks so that the only true solution is a complete cleaning of the world every 2 weeks as further comfortable playing without this action is simply impossible. Regardless of the power equipment used to host a game server, the problem remains the same.

In this connection, I consider it necessary to declare that the game developers are not interested in communicating with the community, are not ready to help players solve the problems with the game and as a result are not interested in the development and promotion of the game. Result - 491 players in the game at the time of writing the message. The result - 66% discount on the game, and such discounts are placed only for obsolete or useless games.

Unfortunately, the developers due to reasons known to me have missed a great opportunity to make candy out of the game, leaving a very unfinished product every 2 weeks under the guise of a formal update, which brings extremely (sarcasm) a lot. The fact that the game has moved to the beta version, suggests that players should not expect a fundamentally new content in the near future.

At the current stage of the game I and our community Red Sky (over 300 people) do not consider it necessary to recommend this product to new players before the policy makers to rethink communication and support for players and further plans for the game. Those who wish to buy the game, I recommend that users pay the most popular view projects in this genre.
(The author is responsible for the reviews posted every word.
Preparation of the text was carried out using the service Google Translate.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A great survival game, It has a wonderful building system with Structural itegrity, Variety, and the game is alot of fun overall. However like all survival games the community is poor, even on PVE or RP servers, it is and will always be KoS gameplay.

After being killed several times by a rogue player, I attempted to speak with the admins and was banned from a popular RP server.

***
A further update on the game, Considering it had an update to patch some of the clipping, lag, and finally some more Optimisation. The combat is alot smoother, though even with this advanced clipping in place, Online I still had a player 'lag' or clip through my homes wall, and suddenly kill me without my knowledge untill I was gurgling on my own blood. Needless to say, The Admins of the server seemed disinterested, and when finally seen to with some intrest, the issue was put down to 'Lag and general bugginess of the game'. Even though this game is fun, and somewhat worth its money, I cannot reccomend it, due to the amount of Hacking (Atleast what I consider it, Taking advantage of lag and bugs.) Or a game so buggy, you lose 100% Of the time in combat or sieges..
Alot of Potential, very little progress.

I become stuck making a rating of this game, especially one out of ten. I have had many hours of fun and enjoyment from this game, but it always seems to leave me with a bad, salty taste when something goes out of your control, like a hacking player or power abusing admin....

What do you think?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When i saw Reign Of Kings or RoK, i felt in love.

For an early access, this game is excellent.

THE LAYOUT:

Clear and simple: they've mixed Chivalry: Medieval Warfare and Rust in a beautiful package.

You are a survivor who ended up on an remote island. With nothing more than a club, few berries, torches, bandages and wearing a loincloth.

You wake up on a beach and after a nice character creation your adventure starts. You have to survive: drink, eat, find a shelter and protect yourself from other survivors that might be agressive.

But soon enough you will discover that the huge stone colosseus which is located at the end of the island is a stronghold where lies the throne of the island's king.

Strong enough you can claim it and decide of a percentage of tax that will be deducted from every players gathering on the island. From 0% to 20 %.

To get the throne you have to create a guild with a banner (you can choose familly members to give access to doors and chests), build a fortress, gear and set up an army of allies ready to storm this place of power.
You can also slay beasts and monsters, like the corrupted humans who roam the plagued village in the center of the map where loot is abundant and powerfull.
Building is easy and physic is present, to sum up it is like in Starforge where buildings are composed of blocks and needs a small set up time to be dropped. Crafting acts around upgradable automated stations. Such as the fire camp, where you can add stones to create a furnace.
Item are commons, clubs, axes, swords, armors, lights, ect... The really funny aspect in crafting is the fact that with enough components you can build siege weapons, cells and torture tools.

Because capturing is the most appealing aspect in this game. With a rope or shackles, you can take a character and drag him into your prison. if you get caught, you can hide a stone or lockpick to give you a chance to escape. But if you can't, you may be whiped before being executed by décapitation ,hanging, ect...

But you won't be always a victim.
The fighting system is really nice and acts like Chivalry. First clic for attack, second for blocking, mouse scroll for 2 others attacks to cut enemie's guard.
The most interresting are ranged attacks, where javelins, arrows and bolts (when they hit) slows characters movements.
When you shoot, if you hold right clic, you can follow the projectile, making your next shot more accurate.

RoK in general is excellent and brings fresh air in a genre dominated by poor games such as Rust itself.


So why i don't recommand it ?


Again, even with a good look and content, this game lacks balance.

Siege weapons.

They need work, like the explosiv barrel for the trebuchet wich has been removed.
The balista is usefull against blocks, but the overal feeling about siege weapons is that they are only fit for destructing blocks. If you want to set other defenses than better walls or doors... you will have to wait. You just can't kill enemy foes with this kind of weapons. Oil cauldrons, spikes or even fire would be a nice addition.

Close combat.

It is still very difficult to handle some times. Mainly because blocking is very punishing especially when you have a one handed sword. That's why many players asks for shields because at the moment 2 handed weapons are overpowerfull.
Add to that the lack of variety in armors and the movement reduction related to it's efficiency:
the heavier, the slower you will be. The problem is that you can negate this reduction by using lower level boots. So if you have a steel armor, wear iron boots and you will run without any major speed reduction.

Resources.
The most important ones are iron and stone wich are located in the center of the map around a vast plain. In general if the server doesn't have rules, players build on theses spots. I'm not ranting about the way developper forced pvp but iron and stone are so rare that when few factions have claimed theses locations you have no chances to gain the upper hand especially if you consider that you can mine a collected spot by hitting the ground where the mineral spawned...
Of course its location never changes.


Hacking.

The game has no protections against hackers. Even if you can use a password, it will destroy you player pool and is not a perfect solution because you have always somebody who speaks to the wrong person...
Hack is a real plague and should be the main issue developpers have to fix.

Servers and admins.

Many servers are roleplaying, the problem is that guilds options are too limited and chat window is too basic to give a correct roleplay experience (even if you role play on your forums, be able to private message somebody is necessary).
Even administration may be a problem because they can destroy everything in a matter of hours just like in Rust especially with the explosiv kegs (wich has been removed few days ago my update of this review).
If you played Rust imagine these admins (and hackers) can brings to rubble any buildings in 2 or 4 hours at max. So it's not loosing your stuff, it's loosing everything, especially if some players uses arrows to scout the land with the right clic ( to be simple, don't try to stay low, you will be discovered anyway due to theses stupid arrows) or goes in your guild and acts as spies to find your location (of course it is part of the gameplay but guild rights are too basic to be really protected, add to that hacking and you can imagine how quick you can loose everything when you are disconected)

TO CONCLUDE:

So if you play this game be ware ! Try to find a good community where admins are not focused on being on the throne and with interresting rules (and a password !).
Try to find structured communities instead of player slots and lack of lag.

Because you won't have any ways to progress in the game or even discover everything it has to offer.
Because this game is still really good and have a real potential.

N.B: i will change my review as the game progresses.
Review updated the 3/24/2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay so if you haven't heard, this game is AMAZING. So, here's a classic steam review story! :)

*REAL REVIEW BELOW

~Spawned on a beach, looked around and didn't see anyone. I then discovered I had a club and decided to run around.

~Stumbled upon two lads in sleeping bags.

~Killed two lads in sleeping bags with said newly discovered club.

~Spent about an hour running around until I finally reached the far end of the map...WAAAAAY away from the kings

~Spent another 4 hours building my base. After I fortified my cabin with a few walls of logs I decided I was safe and it was time to recruite a teamate! So me and this guy met up near the castle and I lead him back to the base.

~On the way he sees a guy, captures him, throws a dungeon on the ground and tells me to place it so we can capture him. Now, at this time I had no idea you could even do that and I pretty much ♥♥♥♥ myself when my new recruit put this guy in the cage and he came on the VOIP screaming for freedom and mercy. Yeah, we left him there LOL.

~We FINALLY get back to the base, build his house on top of mine, build a tower right next to that and place a dungeon inside. We then gear up in iron armor and equip a few ropes.

~We run waaay back to the castle to look for a couple of prisoners and what do you know! We spot a guy and as soon as he sees us he bolts up the hill towards the bridge so naturally as predators we follow him. Unfortunatly for them he leads us to his friend and we end up capturing both of them.

~Long story short, me and some stranger spent about 30 minutes dragging these guys through the forest back to our base on the other side of the map with them spamming the voice keys the whole time and occasionaly demanding we kill them. Eventually one got away but we locked the other in the cage. 10/10 Would capture people again.


REAL REVIEW!
Reign Of Kings is a medieval themed sandbox game with crafting, building, and much much more. You start as a lone peasant living in the king's land, paying the king's taxes. From here you can pretty much do anything right away, although you do start naked with only a wooden club so you might want to get started with chopping those trees.

Pros:~You can capture people
~Yes...literally, you can drag them around the map by a rope and when you feel like it lock them in a cage...or kill them
~This game has ♥♥♥♥ing guillotines and death traps to kill your prisoners in! >:)))
~Beautiful game, great lighting and foilage. made for some great sunrises
~Combat is good, nice and smooth. If you get your range right and kite you can win most fights.
~Tons and tons to craft. Various building materials, upgrades, weapons, tools, etc
~Weapon choice is decent, both meele weapons and projectiles are in the game
~Plenty of wild life! Finally! A game that got it right! So far every time I've went out to hunt...guess what? I've hunted. To many survival games cant balance that, you either run out or its too easy.

Cons:~Trees are a bit glitchy because sometimes they fly away but hey, its ealy access. Actually, for an EA game this is one of the most polished.
~My prisoner escaped is rope! D: how!? he wasted all his rope escape things! :'(
~None.

GET THIS GAME NOW!!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've put some time into this game, and the complaint I have is much the same as anyone else's: There is no moderation on public servers, and people will pretty much always wipe your base the minute they find it. The longest I held onto a base was over a week and a half or so. I had hidden it away, and was feeling pretty clever. Then it was gone.

Once I tried a system where I banded up with other players, and we were neighbors, but had our bases out in the open, and kept an eye out for each other's stuff. Chinese showed up on the server, and hacked everything away, as they have been doing pretty much since I bought this game.

I've watched this game go from being highly recommended, to mixed feedback.
It's a pretty fun, addictive game. I just wish there was a better option to enjoy it correctly than to join a private server.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played this game since it first released and I have played about 150 hours. I really enjoyed it, so why dont i reccomend it you ask? Simply that the devs are not skilled devs. Lets go over some actual game stuff:

BUILDING: The building system uses blocks, it has tiers, alot of people complain that by the time they log on their base is gone. I have never actually been raided on this game because i stayed away from all the good areas and my base was hidden. I understand the frustration with the map balancing because if you want to be safe you are 10 minute walk away from any resources ( Plus time for when you lag.) To be honest the only time you would be truly safe is if you have the highest tier walls and a few layers (Which takes hours and hours to build if your not a massive clan, so long that its not worth it before the next wipe.)

COMBAT: The game follows chivalry warfare combat style however thats not really the case. Its often laggy and you know how that will end if you crash in a fight. To be fair i like the bow but they really haven't improved combat mechanics itself. They just added some new weapons (basically sword but different model) and took them a whole month to finish the work on shields.

RAIDING:  Raids are fun sometimes, the thrill of trebbing someones base is awesome :) However people mostly just raid offline so not really fun if your not active.

Roleplay: I play on roleplay servers, its the only good thing about this server, its a good game for rp with the whole king system. One annoyance about the king is you get those really o.p clans that hold the throne and charge 20% tax. On official servers people just build skybridges to take your throne.

Overall: It WAS a good game with potential, if you like it near enough as it is now buy it. But this game is going no where. You only have to look at starforge to realise these devs are unfaithful.

Tried to return to this game today, after noticing that its been labeled as finished thought id try it out again,

First time i tried it several months ago it was ok, had its fair share of problems (early access yo) which is fair enough. an to be fair it had some really intresting stuff, and was quite fun.

So how did trying it out again today go, well, wouldent launch code,  19 error, after some digging around found out that i needed to disable my anti virus and firewall, (ermm kayy) which did indeed get it to launch.

upon trying to connect to a server i was faced by a black screen. had to control alt delete and end process, as it had stopped responding.

so take 2, launched, tried to connect to server, froze, then a weird graphical glitch across my whole screen, then BSOD.

This obviously is not a issue with my rig as everything, and anything else works 100% fine.

To add insult to injury, upon deciding i no longer wanted to back this game steam decided i was not aloud a refund,

why? well because i have played 1.4 hours over the aloud refund policy agreement , even tho i waited several months to give up on this as i actually dont mind backing early access games and always hope devs will end up making a great product , an there for decided to stick by them untill now.

So somehow by showing support by not immediatly requesting a refund , an actually sticking out the early access phase, i get punished, but the devs slapping a finished sticker on a game that CLEARY is not finished is totally fine by steam, and any early access backers get screwed

an to top it off thats just the tip of the iceburg, never mind all the hacker/cheating issues.

GO STEAM

An this is the second title from these devs" that has been classed as a finished product but is very very far from finished

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of Kings is an action adventure sandbox survival game developed by CodeHatch. We all know of CodeHatch from their past blunder that is known as StarForge. Broken promises and missed opportunities galore with StarForge. Took forever in early access, didn’t make real on half their promises and lets be honest. Their kickstart was a scam. That is highly unfortunate for anyone who backed them. Their game had a ton of potential but it fell hard on it’s face and left a lot of gamers, customers… Very, very, very… Unhappy.



So now we have Reign of Kings. Another early access title by CodeHatch. Should you be careful with your purchase? Absolutely. Since the start of their original Kickstarter for StarForge there has been a slew of survival game releases. So now they have an example to follow. Sure it seems fishy they put this title into early access the same time as Medieval Engineers by Keen House hits, but the two games aren’t really aimed to be all that similar. So lets go to it.

The main focus of Reign of Kings is to survive. To do so you must harvest materials such as hay, flax, wood, sticks, iron, stone, food, water, and other materials. At the core of the game is the crafting system as this is needed really to do anything. The goal is to survive. As most survival games you need to find food and water. We have to eat and drink right? That is after all a trope of all survival. Makes sense we find it in this game.  However look at most survival games crafting is a second hand thing. There is world loot in those games. Not in Reign of Kings. It is all about the crafting. Which really brings the game down in my opinion. I feel the game could benefit from having random generated world and having one or even two “kingdoms”. Having two castles. The two kingdoms could go to war. Then also have the whole civil war within.  The fact that there is one designed map with next to no points of interest aside from the castle and a “ghost town” really kills it for me. I don’t get a good sense of immersion because everything is player built. Honestly… I would just stick to Rust if I knew this was the case.

There is one really cool system to the game though. That is the King system for all intensive purposes. A player can sit on the throne and become the king. If there is already a king the king can be killed. To become king you can go to the castle and sit on the throne. Now there is player structures so a good solid group can fortify the castle pretty well. The design for the castle/island is fairly cool however It would be much more entertaining if the castle weren’t a citadel/throne room and was a tad more customizable. The person who becomes king can rename the kingdom and can also set taxes. I am not to sure what the cap on taxes is but it stands to reasoning if you want to stay king set the taxes high so that the other citizens are starved. It works even better if your community is willing to roleplay.  Still this is the one feature of the game that stands out above the other survival games.



The combat is similar to Chivalry, but it is the weakest point of the game at this point. Perhaps I am not a hardcore player in this sense but it feels clunky, it is very glitchy, and I have not played a survival game with worse combat. The one cool think that is combat related is the ability to capture a person with a rope and drag them around. You can also put them into catches hang them from the gallows, put them in stocks, or chop their heads off with guillotines. There are also siege weapons which will be a ton of fun. The overall look of the building blocks is dull and boring at this point and everything is very blocky in terms of player building. I would love to see some refinement as the game goes through it’s stages in early access and more so a option to add in crosshairs for combat.



The character creation is pretty fantastic and you can build all sorts of crazy looking characters. However at this point there are no female characters and… The hair of the characters is about three generations behind in terms of appearence. The game is visually very appealing but the faces and the hair breaks all sorts of barriers and the graphics become extremely inconsistent in that term.

As time goes on we will see a lot more survival games. Each that have a unique appeal to it. Reign of Kings does indeed have a few things that set itself apart however If your on the mend of a broken heart, or wallet from CodeHatch’s last title. I suggest you wait for development.

I got to play on Gaming-Asylum’s Roleplay server for Reign of Kings and it made my poor experiences from other servers way more entertaining. If you don’t know of Gaming-Asylum they have several Arma 3 RP Life servers and recently had a successful kickstarter for their upcoming game Identity. They know roleplay and have a great community (for the most part.) Check out their Roleplay server by clicking Community and the server browser and search for Asylum.

http://thedrastikmeasure.com/2015/03/14/reign-of-kings-pc-preview/

reviewText:
Alright, this game is one of the reasons I hate Early Access Survival games. The developers always screw up at some point.

There are tons of hackers in this game, and usually indie developers like these never finish their games. I enjoyed the 31 hours I played with my friends before our base was looted by hackers with absolutely no armor that we couldn't even damage.

I would not recommend this game to any of you, because it's just filled with hackers, and you'll have little to no fun playing it. A solution to the hacker issue would be hosting your own server, but that is almost impossible, because it costs extra money, also you need someone on 24/7 to moderate it.

In this game's current state, I can not recommend it.

THIS GAME IS AWFUL, DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON IT

Early Access Review - Will edit in the future
First impression watching videos of the game was that it looked really odd but the concept was awesome.
I bought the game and did not expect much of it but i later came to notice that the game .. while buggy was really well done in terms of an alpha game.

While many claim they see hackers everywhere i have only ever seen one and that one got banned quicker than Husein Bolt running for fried chicken, if you choose to play on Official servers you can not expect more than idiots, hackers and ruleless content... however if you join a community server like mine own 'The viking saga', you will not only experience no lag, no hackers , no dupers, no abuse you will also enjoy the first game experience you have if you are new to the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The tale of the land full of dark colored dwarfs.

I first started playing this game when it launched on steam. And took a break due to it's bugs until recently. Me and my friends picked the game up again, since there where promising news. We joined a large player group and started playing on a server.

First the good. This game has good graphics in general. If you slam up those sliders many areas of the map look great. The combat has a learning curve and the recent update added some nice features, if you kick a blocking person with a shield for example, you can now break his block and hit him afterwards.
The building is in my opinion the greatest part of the game. You can build your own castle and roam through your halls. They have drawbridges, furniture and many building items supporting your creativity to the fullest.
I spend hours and hours placing blocks and items, thinking about how i would raid my base and how to prevent this. Awesome stuff I tell you.

Which leads me to the next part, the raids. Raiding is more difficult and way more expensive then in the early days, making it even more rewarding if you succeed. There is nothing like standing on a freshly raided castle and taking their loot, since the raiding is a core and essential part of the game. On the other hand there is nothing worse then your base being gone the next day you log in. But this is the game this is what you singed up for. Don't complain try again and make it safer next time. They now have these things called totems which can protect your base from being removed completely.

I know this is early access, but since this game is on sale more people should know what they are buying. This game has bugs. You can avoid many of them and many have been fixed in the past. Another thing is the engine. With my gtx 770 I get 60 fps if I don't run the game on ultra" settings. The game is pretty but not very well optimized. If you walk towards a huge base you get massive frame drops
date:
leaving you with 1-5 fps sometimes. I doubt they will improve this by a lot in the beta.

The servers lag a lot. It's great that this game is growing more popular since it leads to full servers. And I have no problem waiting in a queue and to wait until I can play with my mates. The issue I am having is the lag. A full 40 people server is awful. There is no other word to describe it. The nice combat suddenly feels like a stop motion movie and is not decided by skill anymore.

However all these stated things won't keep me from playing the game. The biggest issue are the hackers. We had 3 on our server just yesterday
recommended: raiding our chests without any effort. And this was not the first time this happened. This game has little to none cheat protection. And the game being on sale made it just worse.\n\nI really hope they improve this protection in some sort
hoursPlayed: until then I'd rather recommend to stay away from this game. So you can join the game once it is in a decent state leading to a great experience for everyone.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, what to say?

If youre interested in a full game experience; DO NOT BUY
If you wanna be part of the work in progress thing then you can buy it although i do not recommend it.

The island is insanely small, so youre bumping into others constantly and trying to find a quiet spot to build is not available.
The resources are extremely scarce on busy servers because they all spawn at the same exact location (in the middle), so everyone is farming there.


These things aside (which have been promised to change), i simply wonder where this game is going. There is no survival, sure you have to eat and drink but theres food and drink aplenty, so no challenge there.
Then youre left with building. It is fun, as all other similar games are. But it quickly loses any form of interest and becomes a huge, tedious grind for resources. Especially if your King sets high taxes. If you want to build a castle of more epic proportions be ready to grind an insane amount of trees and stone.
And then comes the question, to what end?  you build a castle and siege weaponry and hang some useless baubles in your newly fetched stone home.... and then go out kill your neighbour?

Im very curious what the devs are intending to accomplish with this game. As it is now, theres no point. After having built your castle, formed a guild and taken control of the island with your clan, there is nothing to do. Why would i want to log back in? I cant be arsed to build anything else (which is the main feature of the game), Being King is not really rewarding in any way (oo i got the best sword and i can get taxes).
It really is all a matter of endgame. This piece of work has none. Since there is absolutely no survival element and that building requires you to grind endless amounts of materials (unlike minecraft), you get stuck with fighting other players. And the fighting mechanics are, to say the least, not the best around.

So unless the devteam (which is credited for a similar game which has dramatic reviews for not finishing their product) comes up with something great to lead this project towards sense. I fear this one is going to get stuck in the limbo.

Im gonna put thumbs down for now, because i cant recommend buying it at this point, ill come back in 6 months to see what has happened and where this is going.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I own Starforge so I sat looking at this title wanting to buy in but having that gut feeling that these developers didn't deserve one more dime of my money. I caved, because I wanted a medieval rust to play. Amazingly the game actually doesn't seem that bad for early access, not very laggy, the fighting can be a bit wonky but is playable, and the building is enjoyable.

However, less than an hour into the game I requested a refund and returned the game. My reason for this is simple, if I want to be killed before being able to accomplish anything, I already own two games that give me that experience, Rust and Ark. The player count is dropping, those left have nothing to do but kill anything that is not in their guild giving fresh spawns very little chance to build up. Updates are slowing down, and being one of the unlucky people who bought into Starforge, it looks like the writing is on the wall to follow the previous titles path towards the sewers.

A real shame, because all I want in the gaming world is a medieval rust with a focus on making survival an actual challenge, rather than a small micro task for your first hour. I recommend you stay away from the game due to the nature of the devs history, nature of the community in these kind of games, and the current gameplay options. However, if you are like me and just really need a medieval rust experience, keep a stopwatch going so you don't miss your refund window.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game CAN be very fun in its current state, mostly on private servers. However, in it's current state there are many bugs which can ruin your gaming experience. For instance people can become invisible when you close a door on them. Doors can also appear as open/closed when they are in the other state, so you can lose all your items. I suggest not having any doors.

They are constantly fixing these types of exploits though, the ability to steal items through walls has apparently been fixed this patch.


The lack of optimization at the moment is also kind of crappy, BUT this appears to be there main concern at the moment so we will have to see how that goes.

Could be amazing but in its current state I could not recommend it to anyone simply because it is not in a finished state and could remain this way (broken) indefinitely.

However, if you are not bothered about the price it is a great addition to your gaming collection.



Kill the TYRANT KING!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm no critic so I'll start by venting some steam.

To Steam, please cut back on Pre-Releases, only allow a few games to go alpha because this has become a bane.  90% of all games are unplayable pre-releases and most stay that way forever.  There should be a punishment system for developers who take too much time to release a game, like paying back people who bought the game, at least 25% of what they paid.

Now on to Reign of Kings.

This game is pretty much a rip off of Rust.  Same crafting mechanics, I mean, identical.

Game is pretty much unplayable.  Every now and then, you get this weird fart/puke sound (I think it's the sound you make when you die) then you freeze, you can't move.  Then you press F, which makes you flex?  I don't know.  Then you can move again (yes, really) but you can't change weapon/access inventory.

Now I understand that it's not supposed to be 100% playable BUT shame on you for releasing a game that requires us to relog every 5 minutes to clear whatever bug makes the game so broken you can't even play long enough to enjoy.  Alphas, at least on steam, should be at least stable and playable because if the goal is only to test, know that there are companies out there who actually pay people to test their games, not the other way around, what's the point?

So right now this game is not worth 20$ only because it's heavily flawed and people shouldn't pay to test a game, they should only pay to play.  Steam should force developpers to make sure their game is stable enough before they allow it to go live.

On the good side, once this game is fixed, I can see lots of fun.  Rust was fun right up until hackers started to show up and make it unplayable.

Right now, this game is not worth it, don't buy it.  Wait for them to fix 90% of what's available right now before you get it.

reviewText: Over 800 hours in the game.  While its merits lie in team-based combat and raiding, those ultimately became its undoing.  From horrendous lag (unless a handful of people are on the server) to countless bugs, exploits and the occasional hacks, the game is just not playable--especially for a full release status.  It was interesting to see Sir Fairnore (the head developer) push for full release by Christmas in order to throw a holiday sale on it and push it to as many kids as possible before abandoning the game.  Yes, this game has been abandoned, and there are no planned updates for it other than the occasional server wipe.\n\nThe game plays more like an alpha-stage game despite having gone through beta and now full release.  Uninstalled. GG.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One REALLLY Important thing you need to know:
Servers are owned by players. This is great for a Team Fortress Server where you invest 30 mins in a match rinse and repeat. For a sandbox MMO this is scary as hell. Examples.
1. They dont pay the bill. Wipe.
2. They have 15 beers and just decide to run around gozilla style and destory crap.
3. Thier son that is 8 goes on a rampage.
* the point here being there is a lot of time and effort to build your castle. Hell I spent 5 hours yesterday getting my small house set up 12 x 12 x 4 entry hall with 2 doors to slow down someone going through doors. I slept for 5 hours and woke up to 6 blocks missing from a wall in a spot I can tell did not get beat now manual. I have no clue how they destroyed my wall but they cleaned out my 30 items i had stored including a starter club, ax, pickaxe. Guessing since they didnt take the easy way in... The 1500 hp door but instead descroy 21000 hps of wall that they used seige or hacked. Not sure. I digress from the point.
** I see no point in playing this game unless you buy a server and run it because otherwise you will eventually lose everything when the owner gets bored. I recommend going in with 2 friends and play 10 dollars each and get a 40 person server and find a few people you trust from other games to pitch in for admin.
*** Do Not Even do that until there is a sure way to ban people and keep them banned.

Pros:
1. FUN
- Minecraft style building blocks for housing lots of cool stuff to make.
- Fun combat when not roped and drug all over the place and dealing with speed/invis hackers
2. Beautiful.
- I like the world itself the art is good. (with the exception of char design which is blah but funny)
3. built in voice
4. Very hostile game. 3/4 people that find you are going to try and kill you.
Con:
1. Private servers (every 30 days you wonder if the lights are going out).
- I'd rather the game designer rent the servers through a hoster so if one is abandonned someone can pick it up.
- You'll really need to spend some time trying to find good/honest admins before you move into a server.
2. Too many hackers/cheating admins
3. built in voice
4. They have a lot of work to do to beat the hackers. **example** no real way to keep people banned.
5. Very hostile game. 3/ people that find you.... this is a huge issue when you spawn and get killed over and over before you can homestead and figure out the map at all.

It all boils down to, IMO, you cant do a sandbox MMO with private own servers/admin. SWGEMU is about the best of that lot that i've seen so far, and anyone that has spent any time on those servers can see how the admin even of the best servers ocationally go off on rampages. With the much smaller investment of 20 to 70 bucks a month the server owner abuses will just be out of control on most servers. And even when they dont abuse very few servers will have the admin support to keep hackers out of you home at 3 am. The current Gen of gammer will eat this game up. Spend 20 dollars once, go to a server hack and steal  a week of someones walls and build a fortress in hours. If you get banned (even if they make it stick) move on to NA E C34 and do it there until you get banned. They have no investment in money or time so what is it to them that they screw up some poor players month of work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do not let the hours deceive you.
I have played this game since release and to be honest, I thought it was a farely good game. I would 100% recommend this game to anyone if one thing was fixed.

Imagine this:
You and your friends are excited to build an amazing structured, thorough and defensive base. You spend all week gathering materials, armour and food to survive and strive with. You begin building the base. You structure it carefully to make sure that it is reinforced well, so that no pesky raiders can get in.

oh no, that's in an ideal world. i forgot the part about where when you log off overnight your base is no more.

The main flaw of this game is logging off. If you want to play with friends, it's useless. Your base will be gone as soon as you are, your items, everything - gone. I can't say it's the players fault, because for many servers, the concept is to capture and overpower others - but ask yourself this, is it really fair that, in a map so small, as soon as you log off, anybody can target you because YOU and your BASE will remain.

Oh also, imagine walking down a path, charging your bow, firing then being launched into the air and dying with over 5K stone, Iron etc.

That has happened twice now.


There needs to be something implemented to fix this, this game may then have better reviews and provide a better experience for the constantly dying community.

tl;dr - this game has everything ready and waiting, it's like they have everything but don't no how to put it together. No real execution.

I feel really bad for writing a negative review about this, but really, I can't have much fun in a repeating cycle of grind, make base, die, base gone, repeat.

Now for my Positives and Negatives.

Pros -
No russians
Decent / Good graphics
A good game concept.
Provides a simplistic but realistic medieval concept.
Good game mechanics
Lots of servers and different styles.
Constant updates and item additions.

Cons-
Your base will be gone if you leave.
Map could be extended a little.
You die so fast from thirst / hunger.
Lots of 'bloodthirsty' people.

Notice, my pros are in a larger quantity than the cons but that is not the point; the point is that there needs to be some fixes to this game before it can be a 'real' game.

Fun to play, but overall I would recommend this game but not yet, do not buy yet, wait until further updates to fix some of these quite important problems.

Reign of Kings, I give you -
6.5/10

reviewText:
Overall:
This game had promise. I purchased it when it was in early access and the game still just isn't finished. Laggy combat is one of the worst of any game I have played. I was hoping for Chivarly-style combat and it fell far short.

Postive:
Crafting system is nice. Graphics are pretty nice even with low-level settings. Concept is unique and fun.

Negative:
Server Lag - Players teleport around while in combat. Bows are useless due to this. Combat is pure luck if you can hit someone. Mostly consists of getting the longest sword/axe you can and just swing until you hopefully catch them as they lag around. Tried many different servers. Latency to various servers was great, there is just some issue with how the game is designed. Servers have to perform frequent reboots due to other problems with the game running for more than a few hours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of Kings is a decent game but is not worth the price of $30. The combat only works if you're not lagging so if you live in the US don't expect to be able to fight very well considering there are only 1-2 populated American servers that are on Stormwall. Stormwall as of Alpha 17 gives consistent crashes after about 30-40 minutes of gameplay and in general runs very badly. You can expect to get around 30 fps on a populated server, unless the map's been wiped recently.

If you go into the game wanting to be friendly with others or just meet new people you will most likely be either captured if you're naked or killed for your gear. You will do well to avoid capture because you will probably be thrown in stocks or a cage until you die of dehydration/hunger. I found the only way to really experience the whole of the game was to play on either a whitelisted or just an RP server. On RP servers you will usually be able to meet people without them wrecking you or sometimes even join a guild and conquer other castles or the throne.

The game's premise and features to have a fun medieval building/warfare experience are all there but sadly the playerbase doesn't let the game live up to what it could have been. The majority of players are greedy and paranoid. If you approach someone else on the official servers there's about a 1/5 chance they will want to talk to you or not attack. Nakeds like in Rust are very dangerous and are only really worth approaching if they are alone. If they get even the slightest semblance of being able to defeat you they will engage in combat. Even if you think the naked is friendly do not let him follow you, he will strike when you are vulnerable. Also kill any girl gamer on sight they usually will do the same except they will have a legion of betamale fart sniffers to back them up.

All in all the game is decent but like I said earlier, overpriced in my opinion. I give it a solid 5/10, there are better alternatives to purchase with your hard-earned dosh.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an alpha and I realize still in development but this game has huge flaws which I doubt will be overcome by these developers.

-  There is no realistic ability to maintain an enjoyable solo experience.  You are pretty much forced to join a guild to survive and not lose your gear upon every logout.

-  Zero immersive factors.  It's grind grind grind for materials and lose lose lose said time and materials...nothing more.

-  Horrible melee fight dynamics.

Honestly the only enjoyable part of this game was building structures.  And those structures can be easily destroyed with seige weapons.

I really don't think anyone in this development team has an ounce of creativity to add enough content to be worthwhile or enough outside the box thinking to resolve the balancing issues for mutiple playstyles or add any immersive enjoyability.
