reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off this game is early access so I undertand there is a lot of development left in the game. If you truly like to aid or be part of the development process then this game might be for you.

The idea of this game is great, but nothing is balanced. There is no sense in building a base because it will get destroyed. If you build a granary you are a fool if you think it will last. All the cool equipment you can build,  water wells, granarys, soon to be saw mills, are just pointless at the current state. You build what you feel is an impenetrable fortress, go to bed, get on, and it is gone. For awhile that was part of the fun... trying to build something that is not destroyed in 24 hours. My friends and I would grind a day out building a base and then boom its gone. Of course we want to be able to destroy bases but the seige weapons are OP at the moment. If you do build a base you better build it floating in the sky, but come on, this is not an anti gravity planet as far as I can tell. Because of the pointlessness of gathering resources, it promotes you to just go kill people and take their resources and their bases which can be fun, but really kills the ability to achieve anything great and put on any epic battles.

Fighting can be fun but once you get all that cool armor you will likely just get raided and have everything stolen in 24 hours or attacked by a group of naked people throwing javelins which is pretty funny at first. If this would be your primary interest then this game is for you. If you are wanting to build an awesome self sustaining compound where you can suit up with your friends in epic armor fighting epic battles... well its not going to happen. Also, there are frquent server wipes where all your work is wiped clean, but that is part of development so I can understand that.  On the other end of the spectrum you have the non fighting RP servers. They are great if that is your thing, but there is just no good middle ground.  It's trolls or carebares.

This game is fun for all the crazy little experiences that happen, but once you realize that it is grossly unbalanced, and its just an endless grind with no real payout, it begins to lose its luster. With this said I am excited see this game develop and I am going to revisit in a month or two to see how its evolved. I wrote this review to add my 10 cents and hopefully aid in development.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is extremely similiar to rust therefore you must treat it like rust.
The building system is interesting being that you place blocks instead of whole buildings or walls which allows people to make very unique and cool buildings but in reality most of the time you will run around a server and see these unfinished buildings which are really un immersive and quite the eye soar

The community is also as ♥♥♥♥♥♥ as the unfinished buildings no one is to be trusted, even the admins.

The combat system is trying its best to be like chivalry but it fails, it fails so damn hard. Most sandboxes try to make a good melee combat system but it always turns into spamming the one attack and praying that you'll hit your opponent

Early Access Review

I like the game very much i like every game where i can build bases the only problem i have with this game is currently when u build a base of any size or tier block strengt it doesnt matter the base will be gone when u come back. The game is fun when u log into the server for a first time get some gear have some fun with being the king, protecting the king or being a rebel as for the base building its is a fun idea but u cant use it because pp will just kill u and steal everything while u sleep.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe combat is unbalanced, you could spend day after day gathering and crafting resources, have great armor and weapons only to be killed in under a minute by a freshspawn with a woodenclub. It's a battle of the ping. You could be a great figbhter but get roped and hanged. You can be killed by doors, you character could die randomly. Sure exploits are gone, but glitches are plenty. it's an Alpha, I get it, the craftinjg system is phenominal. You feel like a king building his kingdom, but the general community is sickening. People from across the globe would enter the server with countless hundreds of ping and beat you everytime. It's a pay-to-win system on whos got the best PC, or the luckiest, theres no skill. I will play this game only when its finished. You could get it now for the ride, but I think your money is best saved by waiting until you know this product is worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Has the potential to be one of the best pvp suvival games out there.

Pros: Awesome enviorment! Lakes, streams, grasslands, well implemented rain and thunderstorms.

Minecraft similar building, fast paced and fairly simple

Gallows, guillotines, holding cells, lasso's nuff said

I like the King implementation, you can name your kingdom and impose a tax or no tax. No tax Kings are generally nice and just, while there are some kings who want 20% of your harvests, those kings better watch out :)

Claim implementaion: Awesome no more noobs building stupid stairs on the side of your base to get in like rust for example

Not a ridiculously giant map, but decently sized. Dont you just hate walking for 2 hours to find nothing or death like h1z1?

Siege Weapons

Food and water are not used as placeholders you still have to survive but you can easily focus on other stuff.

Lots of character customization

Guilds

Chivarly similar combat

Awesome Music!

For the most part im getting 60+ fps on an entry level gaming pc. X9650 cpu 16 gig ram R9 270x gpu



Cons:

Server side issues that lowers fps, expected in a new aplha

Hit boxes for stuff like doors etc need polished Edit: Hitboxes seem to be much better now on alpha 3

Combat needs polished


Overall I can definitely recommend this game its great, though beware it is alpha and you will encounter bugs, server issues etc

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honest review (Alpha 6) after a couple of hours played and trying out over 20 different servers with low ping.

PROS:

+ The game has a unique gameplay offering a lot of things to craft and build in the game world.

+ Big roleplay elements already existing in the game and working pretty ok.
Example:
1) You can tie someone with a rope and then drag him with you.
2) You can hang someone, which is great looking with nice ragdoll and animations.

+ Majority of the game objects are good looking.

CONS (a lot of them atm):

- Always atleast one or more hackers/exploiters in every server (ruining the gameplay totally since it's an unforgiving game when you die)

- VOIP working like ♥♥♥♥, it works perhaps 10% of the times.

- Only a global chat which makes it so hard to understand if someone is rather communicating with you or not.

- Very hard to spot a players name e.g. player has to press G" to show his name and banner. Quick solution.. add nameplates (in the real world you would easily spot someone by the looks
date: but in this world everyone looks the same so add nameplates...)\n\n- Server performance issues after being up a while which is causing major lagg in e.g. chat
voteText:
etc...

- The characters need a rework in animation and mesh. They look and feel bad unfortunatly.

- The melee blocking system needs to be improved both in radius of blocking and animation.


For now i don't recommend this game. I will keep playing it from time to time to keep this review updated and correct."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QHPnCdLzoT4

Got this game for myself and a few friends, played for some time, had some good laughs...realized it was the same guys that made Starforge and then proceed to come to the understanding that this was going no where.

Several months later.

RoK on front page for 8$ or so, wonder how the game has progress? It hasn't, and apparently many who played the game for way longer than I have would agree. What a shame, really, this game actually had something going for it.

Well played ChodeHatch, can't wait to see what you all will fart out next.

Updated: 11/9/2015
Reign of Kings is estimated to release early this Decemeber.

Updates since ALPHA 1 can be found at the following link:
http://reignofkings.gamepedia.com/Changelog#RoK_Update_.28Alpha_2.29

Lots and lots has been added, but alas people don't like the game. There's a reason for everything, or there's no reason at all but large groups of people don't just form opinions out of thin air. Many scores of players have come and gone through the game and yet it has a negative reputation. Perhaps something is wrong with the Steam Review system, maybe more recent reviews should hold higher value than older ones. Or that is a fools dream and all things should be taken into account.
The game itself has always been decent enough to warrent people wanting it to develop INTO something fantastic. Honestly the first time I played it was allot of fun, as I said, I played with a few friends. Seriously, Infestation: Survival Story is fun with a few friends, so that doesn't mean much. Fact is, if you enjoy a structure based voxel game, with a faction based system that relies on your interaction with other players in a knightly setting, than yes you will very much like Reign of Kings. Harvesting, crafting, building and surviving are all part of your experience as well as the chance to take the crown and taxes the plebians. Or maybe you wanna be someone elses pleb, or maybe you just want to be a higher tier pleb on the totem pole so you can control or kill other plebs. At it's core, Reign of Kings has a love hate relationship built right into the gameplay. A player can become king and own the entire land. Players can form together and fight against the evil king or serve under some good king. As always the line of good and evil is never drawn very straight so take it for what the example is worth.

Which comes to what I call the stinky finger of the concept. This is a game that looks really good on the drawing board, and really really well when actually executed in a controlled enviroment. But when you yourself are actually on the playing field....it wafts.
Bad jokes aside, on a decent server with active players that ARE NOT IN A CONTROLLED COMMUNITY you are more than likely to get clubbed to death in the first hour. Say you survive, build up a nice shanty in the woods, all you and your gnomish buddies huddle up in the corner, with the wee lil crest of protection to keep 'realism' from creeping through the front door. But do lul and behold for people found ways around that pretty quickly. In ways the game wants you to be there actively playing it for hours on end a day, no no no, I retract that, it NEEDS you to be there.
'Why is that a bad thing, if I'm playing a game actively shouldn't it be the only game I'm playing?' Cause life doesn't work that way for everyone. That doesn't make it a game killing choice of design but it does put off allot of people who would REALLY enjoy the genre. Nothing brings hordes of people faster to a party than a medieval theme right? Hence why at Alpha 1 release it got such a large following at the gates. But problems develop over time for these cycles. People lose interest, be it getting kicks elsewhere or just getting fed up with the game. More than likely that initial wave of interest had people getting their friends into it left and right. Now the recent discussions on the forums seem to boil down to several communites and a terrible list of official servers. As I said, they tried to fix things and I can only guess it didn't work out. My playtest of the alpha consists of the first few builds so I personally cannot say what and where it went wrong within the games meta development. I'm just here to tell you what I'm seeing as of today.
There is mumbles of a really good modding community for RoK but here we are, taking the limelight away from the stars of the show.
What seems to be a consistent factor with the developer CodeHatch is the disconnection they have with the community. I understand why this is, as the very name of the developer brings the stagnant memory of the previous early access ship they had set sail. Namely StarForge, a game that also has a negative wrap but hardy fans who still would throwndown with you over if it's a 'good' game or not are also present. But from an observers stand point, the community talks and talks and talks to people and their dog about the game but you don't hear so much from the devs. Which seems to be pushing what little is left away. Sadly you get this pushy feeling too with some people from the community as there is always a more 'hardcore' crowd that may be less than friendly to new faces.
So at the end of the day, do I recommend you get this game? Of course not, but I never counted the game out of my zone and in a few ways I still don't. As I mentioned, it's got a final release coming up so I will end up giving that a shot. I'll do a much more serious RoK review video and hey I hope then I can change this to a recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game's mechanics and concept is great. The level of optimization is not. Server lag makes combat nearly impossible. For some, the game crashes every 5 to 10 minutes. In addition, the community is less than reputable for kindness and I've run into several hackers despite the installation of the anti-cheat. Furthermore, I've heard the developer does not put his games on top priority and most likely will not fix these issues any time soon.

I have nothing against the game's concept and how it was put together, it would be a very fun game had these quirks been worked out a little sooner. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but that is my review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was king for a few hours. Made a really good friend, went exploring, collected supplies and then got attacked by a midget yelling your taxes are too high!!! (They were at 2%). Killed him, ran back to my castle with my new friend while being chased by about 15 guys. Took all of our supplies, tossed them over the cliff and then jumped off together.

All in all this game is loads of fun... sometimes. Its very laggy, even on official servers. The combat is extremely good at times but when it lags it makes it almost imposible to hit or even see where somebody is. In my story above whilst i was fighting the midget, he would be hitting me even though he was way off in the distances to the point where i could barely even see him.

There are many glitches aswell... although that is to be expected out of a early access title. But some, if i may mention them here, are when you press c to toggle between 1st and 3rd person you will sometimes teleport to a new spawned person somewhere on the beach. When chopping down trees, some of them will fly up into the air and then disapear, animals like dear or moose will do the same thing aswell.

Also, one major thing that i found was one time i was building my base near the stone nodes and then  randomly teleported onto the thorne. Lets just say the king was a bit suprised... Lol

But you get my point that this game is not perfect. There are many other glitches to be found like people flying, falling through the map, to randomly dying and loosing all your stuff, getting stuck in one spot and not being able to moove and the list goes on.

But all in all it has the potential to be a really great game and with some fixes this could be amazing!!

Also one thing i think should be added is horses that you can tame and ride around on. As well as be able to make armor for them and so on, you get my point. Would make getting around a lot easier :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game concept and the fun gameplay.  Its got a minecraft open world building style, but with simplified resource gathering that is limited to nodes that repop fairly often, I really enjoyed building castles, and upgrading the crafting stations to build better and better items.   The pvp combat system is pretty cool, but can be difficult with lag.   I enjoyed defending my castle with guild mates, but never quite got to the point of trying to be king.   Im not a great PVPer, so the full loot drop can be annoying, but that is part of the game.  No problem there.

The big problem comes with griefers.  Getting attacked while you are in the game is part of the game, but logging back in after a day away, and fining ALL of you stuff gone kinda ruins it.  Im not sure if there are exploits that allow some people to pick up your stuff, or if they really spent the time to smash every single item, but on our server several people were shocked to find everything that they had built gone.    There is no safe storage, and even when you log out, your body stays in game, and can be killed and looted.   I was on a NO GRIEFING" server
recommended: there is no way to identify people until they waive at you.  So you cant tell friend from foe unless they happen to be wearing different armor.  So if someone kills you and takes all of your stuff
hoursPlayed: you dont even know who to to get revenge on.\n\nSo at this point I am done with this game.  I will watch for updates
voteText: and I will be glad to change my recommendation to Yes if they come up with a way to stop griefers."

If you intend on playing this solo or on a public server get ready for a long dreadful experience in a hacker's dream of a horrible developer creation of an amazing medieval world. If you know anything of these developers then you know they created the alpha starforge and abandoned it after more than a years worth of false promises to backers and its community. However, if your like me and are a stupid fool who doesnt learn after getting bent over once then join me in the stupidity of alpha access games. Where developers make tons of money for making a great initial release of a game hype up its community with promises to come then after seeing sales plummet after a couple months of the initial release decide...hey lets just make a new game instead of pouring hundreds of hours into a game that will make us less in the long run...The direction this game can go is endless, the devs can redeem themselves by creating the best indie game of the year if they just stick to improving the game's engine and adding more content to the game. reviewText:
Reign of Kings has some interesting ideas that make it stand out from just another run-of-the-mill Crafting/Survival game. The only problem is utilizing these ideas so that they actually have impact and make the world feel real and unique.

I think it would be interesting if you did not have to pay the King's tax, but doing so runs the risk of the Kingsmen/a tax collector coming after you or putting a bounty on your head. It would also be great if you could become say a Merchant, and sell/barter goods from a stand. As well as if the King could do good things too, like plan cities and organise the people to improve the land on which they all share.

The character creation and voxel building are good the way they are, and I enjoyed the combat when I played as well. The maps are cool as well, especially the procedural ones.

All in all, I think Reign of Kings is at an important position in the crafting/survival world; They have all the means to make their game THE definitive medieval crafting survival game, but it is currently stuck as Medieval Kill-the-man-with-the-ball" and I fear that will not change any time soon. It is for that reason that I cannot currently recommend this game
date: but if they add some more structure to their already great concept and decent execution
recommended: I believe they can become a front runner of the genre
hoursPlayed: or at least medieval gaming enthusiasts.\n\nAs of 12/16/2015 I will be looking into future updates for RoK and will change my review based on how those updates improve/damage the game."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So this game is a lot like legacy Rust, which is why I bought the game in the first place. The graphics, build system, perma-death, and sleepers are all very similar to Rust. The combat, just like the trailer mentions, is much closer to chivalry. Other features from promising failed EA titles like The Stomping Land, where you can trap and cage other players.

One thing that immediately stood out (please don't ask why) is a certain slot you are able to use. Most FPS games have quickload slots to quickly equip a weapon by pressing 1 2 3 4 5. This game has a slot 0, labeled orifice"
date: in which you can put sharp objects into in case you get yourself into a sticky situation (captured by another player for example)
recommended: you can then remove your sharp stone from your orifice and cut yourself free.\n\nAfter playing for a couple hours
hoursPlayed: I then went to tell my girlfriend about the orifice slot

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love this game already. As you can see from my playtime, I'm playing this exclusively since it came out. This is my 4th edit, editting it each day of alpha. TL;DR - Yes the game is very much worth your time, and at 20 dollars it's a steal. I would recommend it up to 40 dollars tbh.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MOST IMPORTANT IMO - SANDBOX FACTOR: Obscenely high! Everyone wants to make a sandbox game these days, and almost all of them fall short of the most important thing: something to DO that feels meaningful. With these other titles, you start the game, you make your fortress/grind out top end crafting, and you're done. The game is over. If PVP is a thing you defend it, but it's live or die and respawn.

In this game, you have a king who constantly taxes you. That guy is the worst. All of your activities as a little islander peasant are constantly accompanied by a sense of something more: either you're working towards gearing up to take on the king, or you're working towards making your little shack in the woods to gank people at, or you're building an impenetrable fortress to house your max level crafting tables and hoard of materials.

There's no other way to put it: with the perma death, loot loss, always-existing (when you log out you're just laying there in the game, asleep and vulnerable)  and the options for imprisoning and such, the game feels meaningful, and not like another empty sandbox.

As far as gankfest goes: On a server with a large popualtion of new players, the spawning beach" rapidly devolves into a Rust-style "beat people with sticks senselessly" idiot-fest. However
recommended: people ratehr quickly evovle past that. Ocne you get some armor on
hoursPlayed: I woul say 1 out of every 5 or so people you encoutner will kill on sight. Most are just trying to build their little home and don't wanna fight to the death over some berries.\n\nWhich brings us to the real glory of this game. The sandbox is so real. remember how ArcheAge offered us player housing? Remember Star Wars Galaxies
voteText: where you built wherever and made it home? This game has what you want. Build a structure and hang a crest on the wall
helpfulPercent: and no one can build within a certain radius unless they breach your walls (which requires siege equipment at higehr tiers
votesHelpful: and a double thick wood wall would take 45 minutes to break a one-tile hole through) and take out the crest. No one can minecraft-style build a little bridge and hop your wall if you have a creat up and you build intelligently. You can absolutely have your own fort... and once the server grows

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't really recommend this game for a few glaring reasons.
Combat system- A dude with a club can kill a fully kitted player just by constantly swinging the club. No skill at all is needed as the club stuns you and resets all combat animations. I have tested this several times, and even as king, you can be rekt by a single dude swinging a damn stick against a man in steel armor and a 7ft flamberge. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.

Siege equipment- takes a ton of resources to make and to make ammo for. On the up side, you can load the stupid thing with so much ammo that one shot can take out an entire wall of stone (and no I don't mean cobble, I mean the top tier stone) that is 4 thick. I can literally spend a day getting and crafting 500 shots, and then go to the biggest and baddest base, and 2 shot it to oblivion. Woo friggin hoo.

Lack of any anticheat or region locks- this, this right here, is the biggest detriment to this game. The fact that I , along with 13 others, held the throne on a server for 2 weeks, just to have 4 asian hackers fly in and remove all of our crests, made me give up entirely. 4 people was all it took to kill a server.. 4. I saw these 4 ♥♥♥♥tards on several other servers, with much the same result. They came in, removed all the crests from player bases, spawned in trebs and ammo, and ♥♥♥♥ed an entire server. We held them off for four days hoping that they would just get tired of being owned over and over, they could have cared less. And so could codehatch.

Overall- don't get the game. Official servers are rife with hackers and griefers. Private servers are rife with morons and rpers with stupid rules. Do yourself a favor, if you feel like getting this game, bash yourself in the face with your keyboard. YOu'll feel like doing that anyways after a few hours on an official server.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, before I even go into any variation of explanation / input, it should be noted that this game has no angle of PvE. At all. If you intend to play this game alone, in a non-competitive manner or simply want to build castles in a medieval sandbox game, look elsewhere. This game and everything about it is, well, competition. If you cannot deal with loss, whether you had opportunity to deter it or not, don't bother. Fair warning given.


---

Combat: Simplified / not as polished, Chivalry-like combat with a limb and parts health limitation. That said, I'm not complaining. Blocking, countering and general combat is simple and easy to grasp. Gear makes a pretty decent difference but a skilled player can and will easily out do a person with superior gear.

Map: It's actually perfect, for now. The resource nodes for important materials are in locations that actually demand eventual conflict. The map itself actually looks pretty damn good and the map's size isn't anything that I personally can complain about. Players should have no problems establishing castles or hovels around the map.

General Gameplay: As I said with the paragraph above, it's all competitive play. People will screw you over and given the opportunity, you can, should and probably will do the same. Don't come into the game expecting to be untouchable and don't come into the game alone. These things considered, it's a really entertaining game to play with friends. A few bugs do exist here and there but, it's Alpha. The hell do you expect?


- It should be noted that they've begun arming admin staff with methods of effectively removing players that are using hacked clients. If you are genuinely having issues with hackers and the sort, I suggest NOT playing on official servers. Instead, look into a community server with generally active and competent admin staff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okey, so i've had fun. I've enjoyed the game, im a mediveal loving guy, i enjoy both Game of thrones and Tolkiens Fellowship of the ring worlds.

So it isnt without surprise i loved this game for its massive immersive world, having tons of options to capture and punish or imprison another player.

There are a big range of weapons with their own statistics, however the PvP lag is always looming in the back of your head. My favorite weapons would be Bow and arrow & Axe or mace.

Building takes forever but its well made in my oppinion since it makes sense that one person shouldnt be able to build a massive castle within a day. so bring friends :)

This game if you're planning to play on Public servers... are somewhat KOS. however joining community servers gives you a better experience since they usually have some kind of rules that are enforced by admins.. usually active ones but not always. so dont quote me on that.

Now....

This will summarize my first 2 hours in this game..

I join into a server with my friends, it had a nice ping of around 44 so i thought hell yea!
Well in, im confronted with nice pretty graphics and a stick to beat down trees with if i need to wich i do since its the only way to progress unless someone gives you stuff or there is a /kit function on the server.

I happily cut down some trees and explore the Crownland map and i see a yellowish field infront of me.. i run to it and think this has to be some kind of desert or something. (actually Hay field).

Im now around 150m away from said field and my computer freezes.. ALL STOP IN THE ENGINE ROOM! basicly.. Im like.. what the ♥♥♥♥ happend? did something happen? did another program all of the sudden soak up every bit of resource i can muster to do this?

NO, IT WAS ♥♥♥♥ING RENDERING BUILDINGS! THE GAME HAD BEEN RUNNING FOR ABOUT 120-170 FPS (At around high settings) ALL ALONG UNTILL I GOT TO SOME BUILDINGS!

THE rendering mechanism in this game is so bad that if you dont have a highend computer it will freeze you up.. usually my computer restarts itself since it cant recover.

Do NOT buy this game, do NOT support this piece of crap development team.

Unless they shape this ♥♥♥♥ up with the PVP lag, Render issues and other bugs i've heard stories about then dont even buy it, If u want it? then wait for the finished product.

Thanks for reading.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With early access games, you either find a game you really like, or you find one you really don't like. For me, this was one I did not enjoy.
The graphics are really nice and the concept is neat, but this is about the only positive things I have to say. Let's star first with the fact that you could work for hours building your fort, crafting weapons, and gathering resources. When you log back in, all of that could be gone by either other players, or the server shuts down. And the combat system is horrendous on top of the constant lag the game has from time to time.
I was willing to think hey
date: this is an early access game. Maybe there will be improvements?" I deleted the game from my computer
recommended: but it seems that they are still working on this game. I appreciate that the developers are still trying
voteText: I will not be building up a castle and praying that it won't be gone when I go back. I value my time too much. For $20

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI understand the concept of early access
date: but in it's current form, which I paid 20 bucks for, this game is not playable. A game in which you can spent several hours building structures and collecting resources could lock up and roll back the server at any moment, erasing any progress you may have made. In my 5 or so hours of play time, this happened 4 times. Combat is so laggy that hits to you or enemies can take 2 or 3 seconds to register, people can loot chests through walls, and there are already several hacks and exploits that are being implemented on several of the servers I've been on.  I wanted to like this game, I really do, the idea behind it is great. But in its current form this game is a freaking mess and more of an exercise in frustration than fun.

reviewText:
I really want to recommend this game. but sadly it is another F*** up from code hatch. I have played this game for 700 hours I played it once it came out stopped for months then recently came back.

The game is Extremely fun when it runs smoothly! But sadly it is rare but less rare when you are playing on a good server I would recommend playing on 247 gaming world I've been playing on it for most of my time on this game and it is reliable in the middle of a fight a lag spike can happen ruining the strategy.

There are still hackers on this game but just find a good server with active admins and your fine. The hackers tend to rule neglected servers/official servers I would stay away from official because things may look fine AT FIRST but eventually a hacker will come and destroy everything you have created.

Even tho most people give a bad review for this game most still play it including me. So if you are willing to play this game and deal with all of it's problems you will probably have fun like I said it is extremely fun when it works.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good game and very high fun rate with friends or solo.


But why am I giving it a negative review? Because of one, game breaking bug.

Some times when you log off then log back in you will come back to where you logged off. But you character model will be the default one (Fat, Bald, Ugly, big) and all your gear is gone and you are stuck with it till another server wipe or play on another server, but then the bug can happen on that server as well rendering the game unejoyable. And you can not fix. (Yes I know about name thing but they fixed that in this build. It's still broken).

The game over all is an amazing experience but this random bug, you don't know when you will get is very game breaking.

Till this bug is fixed it will have a negative review, if the above bug does not bother you then you are in for one hell of a awesome game.

reviewText:
I've had this game since at least Beta, played many many hours, but always had the same bug, I haven't come across anyone else with it so this review is based entirely on my own experience.

The game has a great concept, capturing and imprisoning others in an open world farm/build/survive style.
Grouping up with others is definently the best way to go to survive, create a clan and rule the land! You can even become the King and raise taxes and claim some tribute.

My problem is that the game times me out of every server after about 5-10 minutes of gameplay, hard to explain but it's like I lose the x,y,z coordinates of every other object in the game, other players can still see me but I cannot see anyone else. I then have to quit the game wherever I am, and relog in, (usually this results in death). This ruins the game.  I was hoping that since the game is actually released this would of been patched.  Alas same issue.

So overall score 1/10

reviewText:
This game has a great concept, in theory.  I can't say that I havent enjoyed playing it.  The environmental graphics are superb. The background music is very nice as well.  That being said.. lets focus on the bad for what its worth.

Firstly, since the beginning the hackers have destroyed any semblance of fair play in the game.  It really is sickening to create an impenetrable abode, and find it in ruin the next day.

Hackers arent really the fault of the developers and they have made strides to counter the pieces of @$#% that choose to exploit. But its an uphill battle with no real end in sight.

Secondly the pvp in this game is attrocious. Essentially, its frantic button mashing and jumping around like an idiot.. and in the end its rarely about skill, as much as it's about your equipment, and dumb luck.

Thirdly even if hackers aren't involved there always seems to be douch bags on every server that are able and willing to raid your base at night and take or destroy the hours and hours of work, you put into your creation. As this really is part of the game, it just seems a glaring design flaw to expect players to keep coming back to try again and again everyday. And you do come back, with better plans everytime.. but after time the frustration becomes too much.

And lastly, and this might just be me, but.. The developers have just announced that they are going to try and do a monthly wipe on the first of every Tuesday. So if you are finally able to get any semblance of a base and supplies stockpiled, you definatley wont have it for too long. Because after the wipe.. you start all over ... from scratch... nada.. zippo.. ziltch. . not even a toon to call your own.

This last point is the most frustrating of all to me. All the other challenges I take in stride. Trying to overcome them is almost a game in and of themselves. But now It's all pointless to me, because I know any struggles I overcome will all mean nothing once they wipe. Whats the point..

reviewText:
I really do enjoy this game. The concept is great and would make a perfect survival game, thats if it was executed properly. I love building things, I love raiding, I love fighting in PvP. But, there is severe problems with the game.

This game is plagued by chinese with over 300 ping which makes the PvP in the game a joke. Half time I am fighting someone with a high latency and they can hit me when I cannot even see them. This makes people with full steel gear lose to a naked. Not fun...

Another huge issue is the fps. Even with an extreme gaming rig I seem to drop to 10 fps on the lowest settings, making fighting almost impossible. I have no idea why this is happening, but most likely to do with the renderer and the awful engine.

If the developers actually listened, maked regular updates to the game, fixed the horrible servers and brang in ping detection to get rid of all the chinese, the game would be great. Hopefully one day we will recieve the true RoK.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Woke up on a beach, It was beautiful.
The sounds of birds and gentle sea waves caressed the air.
I took my first steps along the beach, it was a calm night but was still fairly hot.(lucky as I was pretty much in the nude)
I continue walking till I saw a light, it seemed like a fireplace. I could smell barbecue in the air, my belly rumbled and I decided to run towards it. As I got nearer to the fire on the beach I could see 4 little people running around it and dancing. I stopped running and walked. “Hey guys!” I shouted. They stopped moving and slowly turned towards me. One started to play the drums and another the flute, I started to laugh and complement them as the tune they were creating was very good. The two other midgets came closer, one shouted “Hmmm tasty” as they walk towards me. He out of know got a gigantic iron sword. I immediately halted, “Hey, I come in peace”.
I lost sight of the other small guy but he had actually ran behind me. As the midget with the massive sword came towards me, the midget behind me tied me. My body suddenly flopped. “What are you doing!” I shouted on the top of my voice. “We are doing what we must do” said one of the little guys. They put me onto a Guillotine. “You don’t have to do this, I wasn’t going to do anything” I cried.
Out of no where a guy approaches. “Put that wee lad down” he says as I smell a sour onion sort of smell caress the air. “IS that… is it… thats…. It’s Shrek!” I Call out. “Help me please” He reveals his ogre sized sword and destroys the midgets. “Oh your my hero mr shrek!” he keeps me in the guillotine and strokes my forhead, he says “I child, nothing to be scared now. I’m here wee boy” As he walks behind me. “whaa aren’t you going to let me out?” I ask, “Not yet” I feel being whispered into my left ear with his warm onion breath.

That was the last I ever saw of this guy, as my computer decided to disconnect from the internet. The mystery is that my body would have been there left logged in for a few minutes… I wonder if I did ever get set free.


17/5.6 would defiantly order from this seller again!

reviewText:
Lots of potential, very little execution.

The most problematic part of this game is the 300+ ping players on public servers (many Chinese folk playing NA #2), the frame lag, and the hit detection of the combat is absolutely atrocious. If executed well it would play out much like Chivalry:MW in the combat but because of all of the above it turns in to spam your LMB and pray that what you're seeing on your screen is real and not the afterimage of a person who is soon going to teleport 15ft and then hit you for full damage completetly out of range.

For $5...meh.
For $20...oh hell no.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I haven't run into hackers yet, but I cannot recommend the game at this point.

Pros:
Good game for ♥♥♥♥ing around.
Building is fun.
The King system, and taxing is a cool idea, and is executed well enough.

Cons:
The combat system is interesting, but server lag makes it extremely difficult to time things properly.
Hackers. (Even though I, myself have not run into them.  Try to play on less popular servers if you do end up getting this)
Still very buggy atm.
Not much to do other than, collect resources, build, raid, get raided, etc.
Not worth playing on your own.

Ultimately, Roleplaying servers can be fun, but I would recommend Rust to anyone who wants to buy this.  Rust essentially plays the same as this but is much more polished.  Perhaps with a few updates this game could be good but as is, I cannot recommend it.

It's sad to say but with 88 plus hours in game it has alot of potential but balce and exploit issues are common.

When reporting the hacks and exploits found on a Code Hatch server nothing was done - FAIL - . So that given there was really no point in trying to stay on that server. Basically we have a group of Asians that come on the server early in the morning and wipe out everything utilizing exploits and or hacks. Since the development team does nothing to fix the issue the game play" on the official server is basically dead.

Few updates the devlopment team is moving too slow on the project - Huge ♥♥♥♥ing FAIL - the player base is dropping like flys.

Maps are too small and tax servers heavily the game needs optimization.

Resource nodes too few and poorly placed making building a tough job.

PvP Hit mechanics are spotty at best

Players can create super small avatars to avoid being hit.

******* Conclusion Buy Rust *********"

reviewText:
This game will never be finished, it will never be fun for more than a day at a time, and you will always rage at it.

It's combat is trash. It's land claim system is trash. It's mechanics are so easy to abuse that literally everyone does it because even if you try to be the honest player eventually you become the prick that kept smashing your ♥♥♥♥ down with relocating trebs and invincible ugly as all hell cobble walls.

There is no winning in this game, there is no survival, it's a sandbox for people to ♥♥♥♥ one another off and eventually rage quit after spending hours to make something pretty only to have it torn down. The only way to stay ahead of the tide is to make an ugly as all ♥♥♥♥ box in a steel crest area and add layer upon layer, eventually making a colossal cube of stone... Just to protect a room about 5x5 in size.

Do. Not. Buy. This. Game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI loved this game. It had incredible potential, had great mechanics, a skill+gear dependent fighting systems. But the developers bailed on it. Its an Early access game, its missing the fundamental systems to make the game complete. A faction system where you could ally different guilds, an integrated shop system so you players could actually set up a marketplace that was backed by mechanics, a war system to motivate combat, etc. This game had great potential, and its not a bad game. But it's not a finished one either, and unless someone creates mods to fix the the gaps and even create new content, I don't think this game will survive the long hall :/

reviewText:
I retruned to check out the game's progress, and I'm disgusted.

The anti-hacker programs haven't done a damn thing! If anything, the problem has increased dramatically. If you're not being one-shotted, constant report spamming will ban you for life.

Seems, Codehatch, has given up on fixing the bugs people report. They just take the offending program code out, and that's it.

The whole PvP core of the game, seems non-exsitent. Other than players killing each other (including one-shot hackers), the whole castle-raiding thing just isn't there. No castles collapsing into a pile of rubble. You just create holes big enough to get inside, steal what you can, then run back to your castle before your opponent is done repairing theirs.

There hasn't been anything from the developers for months. No update or bug repair reports, answering the concerns of the players, just nothing.

Please don't buy this game, even if you plan on renting a private server. Youtubers and other live streamers dropped this game a long time ago, and I believe there's a few 100 players still loyal.

I've reported this game, and Starforge, to Steam. Hopefully, they'll understand my concerns and remove both games. Codehatch ran, abandoning both games and their respect players, only to profit from the cash people are still sinking into them.

reviewText:
I have never been so actively repulsed, frustrated, and ultimately angry at a online game.

For starters, there are constant issues for the optimization of streaming data in this game. Expect your connection to buckle under this game, for playing this game while on teamspeak proved an impossible feat. It was impossible to connect to any server - official or community, local or overseas - while running any other program that used any considerable amount of bandwidth. Most every other game I have ever played can handle teamspeak 3 in the background in addition to music streaming and other things, but this game is not up to that task.

Onto what little gameplay I experienced, it is lackluster. Gathering resources is an abhorrent, boring task. At the rate of collection and simply finding resources to collect, this game is worse than most other survival games in many regards - even those noted for their occasional sparsity of resources. The gameplay itself, in what little was experienced, was terrible on all fronts - especially the receiving end of 'combat', which is a complete disaster. The combat combined with the latency and bandwidth issues made it possible for me to be attacked with a six inch dagger from over twenty feet away, ruining any chance of response and making fights entirely one sided.

But the community -- oh, dear lord, the community. If you for some reason purchase this trainwreck of a game, stay away from official servers. They are plagued with people who are playing on the wrong servers and have horrible ping, scream in voice chat and fill up with text chat with intelligible conversations. In addition, this game is worse than DayZ with regards to the KOS mentality, with the combat system contributing to the problem due to its non-parity and numerous engine problems.

The only possible positive this game can muster to draw from its ♥♥♥♥ crusted pile of dung is the graphics, which are good for the intensity they place upon the user's system and the tradeoff of apperance. But it numerous drawbacks with a sort of pseudo-motion blur being pervasive, even after disabling motion blur itself, with pixel dragging and visual distortion on numerous levels of graphic settings.

Save yourself the money, and just go buy Rust.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

REVIEW UPDATE OF 12/13th MARCH 2015:  Game's a bomb! Creative, varied, oppressive, dominant, completely crackhead in the soul! BUY IT!


FIRST REVIEW /11th MARCH 2015:  This game is good fun! Smooth and playable at most, i bet it will become addictive in the future, at the beginning i was playing in an empty server, but i realized that is way more fun in a full one, that holds at the moment around 20 players.

TO BE AN ALPHA THIS GAME GIVES A GOOD APPROACH AND APPEARS TO BE WELL THOUGHT:
The character personalization looks fun and quite complete, compare to many other survivals where you are constraint on a standard model. Gathering and Crafting are easy to understand and not stressing at all, you start with a club and you can collect already wood and several plants in order to craft something. Wildlife and enemies like monsters are varied and very challenging, PvP combat is interesting and requires some skills, cause i got killed from a freshly spawned guy for example while i was equipped with a full wood armor and a better club, as well as some throwing stones, yet i died, maybe he was hacking, who knows, this is just a VERY FIRST IMPRESSION of the game, but i find it polished enough to be at this state, a really good start indeed! I will upgrade the review as soon as i play a bit more, thumbs up at the moment!

reviewText: This game sucks. I played almost 70 hours, hoping that, sooner or later, upgrades would have improved it. They didn't. Developers just added a bunch of useless stuff, instead of changing what really matters, for me and for the other players: optimization and, above all, an effective anti-hacking system. I collected a lot of materials, harvested entire forests, and what I obtained was always the same things:\n- base robbed by some whiny kids (they came to my home saying: give us all you got

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At this moment in time the game is broken(A10) and honestly i dont think it will be heading anywhere soon.
-The engine is horrible with combat feeling like your swinging your weapon in the air praying u hit the other player. The jump mechanic can we unblievable sometimes where you can triple jump over walls or simply just build blocks in thin air and get in 4 block thick walls. Ranged weapons feel like your shooting the slowest arrow ever and javelins feel like your a special kid throwing your toy in a tantrum
-The community is pretty horrible. Its very rare to see someone who will actually talk to u instead of killing you on site or chasing you around the map till one of u dies of boredom and gives up.
-Every server has obvious hackers who sometimes will just grief everyone on the servers for hours on end without any admins support (community servers are a little better but soon as the admin gets off everything turns to ♥♥♥♥)
-Theres no point in even building a fort or grinding out resources, while your offline ur fort will prob get trebucheted or hacked into and all those hours u spend building it and smelting iron and steel, gathering resources and robbing other players makes you feel kind of stupid for wasting your time.
I give ROKs a 7/10. Its cheap but it kinda feels cheap

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game wasn't bad starting out everyone was friendly and a lot of chatting. After about 2 hours in everyone was killing people that where working together taking gear saying sorry that they would return their stuff just to kill them again. So after that I decided I would find a small area hidden from everyone to just get my feet wet. Everything was going well and durning that time frame about an hour or 2 people kept killing the new king and they would raise taxes to 40% or more. That slowed me down because it takes I beleive 40 wood to make one block for your house. After I finely finished my house and a bed to sleep on I decided to get off for a while. I decided to log on before bed just to be on the safe side to make sure no one broke in. Well there was two blocks missing from my house but they did not kill me or loot my place since I really didn't have anything that they couldn't gather in acouple of mins. so I decided to be tricky and double block my house and hide my loot crates under the floor so I could sleep at night not worring about anyone robbing me. The next day was my day off from work so I deided I would get a early start to building a wall and traps around my place to be extra safe. Well I logged in dead and my bed was broken so I had to spawn on a random spot on the beach half dead (not really sure why since when I fisrt logged in every bar was full.) Ayway I decided to go find my place and when I got there half of my base was gone and replaced leaf blocks and in the front there was a sign that said China #1. So I got into chat since everyone hates the Chinese I asked them to help me take my base back but no one answered me they was all to busy trash talking every other. So after a while I broke in and killed everyone inside and their beds. They had a lot of rare items I knew I wouldn't be able to defend by myself so I asked if anyone wanted to team up and take all their loot and everyone just talked trash to me. I then decided to throw everything into the ocean so no one could have it and then quit. The game itself isn't to bad they had a great idea.  I guess you can say the community ruined the game. I would not buy this game unless you have at lease 5 people or more to play with that will be on at all times of the day. It's just to easy to lose everything meaning... To build an okay house and sig you need to claim land it would take about 4 hours or so. Once you log off someone can come and break down your door or wall in about 10 mins or less and then break your sig in about 5 mins and then claim then they have a nice base and you have nothing. Think the game would be better if they had pvp servers and a hardcore pvp. Meaning in pvp you can kill anyone that is in the open but you can't break into their base it's like a safe zone in normal MMORPG's. Then in the hardcore pvp you aren't safe anywhere.  Just an idea though.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of Kings, while in early alpha, shows a lot of promise to being a game that I could regularly play and want to play with friends. That being said, there are a ton of mechanics that should be implemented to make the game what it could fully be instead of the base outline it feels like right now, as well as a ton of things that need to be changed in order to make the game more playable and fair.

First of all, what I liked. The learning curve is not too bad. It gets harder as you progress, but there's a friendly community and a wiki page to help with later game crafting and building. Not only that, but the building in this game is so satisfying. The hours I've sunk in have resulted in some of the most badass looking fortresses and castles I could ever have imagined. And the feeling you get after hours of mining when you put on a suit of steel armor like the knights of old is one of the coolest moments in the game.

Now, on to what i hated. This game is frustrating. Like, Dark Souls level frustrating. The amount of materials you need to acquire to get basic building blocks is a bit ridiculous and really stalls out the building process. And the blocks that you can build quickly are so weak it takes any new character 10 minutes to break in and steal all your stuff. The character creator has little to no variability, with deformed, creepy looking characters being the majority of what you see and taking away from the gameplay experience. Combine that with the glitches that characters can do based on their height and weight, it makes the game unfair and forces you to have setbacks that shouldn't really be there. I've lost tons of bases due to midgets hopping on each others' backs and boosting over walls or going under rocks that normal sized people get stuck on.

The combat is sticky and buggy at best. I don't have a high end rig, but every battle I get into ends up with me lagging out and ending up dead within seconds despite having better gear and armor. The ranged mechanics are average at best, but with little to no hit detection on other players, you can't really use a bow on someone. Oh, and armor is useless in this game. All it does is slow you down. People with starter clubs can beat down people in steel suits of armor like its made of aluminum foil. You're better off avoiding anyone at all than risking a fight.

Lastly, the resources are so stupidly placed. You have to run around to find a dirt node" to harvest dirt when you have been running on nothing but dirt for hours. Iron and Stone are always surrounded by either a lot of players or hostile wildlife
date: neither of which will let you get away with hard earned resources.\n\nI've ranted for a bit
hoursPlayed: the game shows promise. If the developers added in RPG elements
voteText: it could be a fantastic game that rewards the time you put into it. As of right now
helpfulPercent: however
votesHelpful: its simply not a fun experience for invested Roleplay players or passive players. If/when these issues are addressed
votesTotal: I will be happy to play the game to my fullest extent. Until then
votesFunny: avoid it."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI really, really wanted to like this game. It had an amazing idea, but failed miserably when trying to execute it. Usually I don't give games flak for their technical issues (unless they are wide-spread issues and not limited to a minority). But this bug is so common that I will not be surprised if a lot of refunds are being processed at the moment; Australian's can't join the only two Aussie servers. I've had to joined 250+ ping servers. It's unplayable. The lag is too great. I have a great rig (4770k, 980Ti, 10gb RAM, etc) and I can't even 60 FPS on Medium graphics. The crafting system is okay, the King system is okay. The game is okay. I am refunding because it is literally unplayable for me. I hope to buy again if they fix these bloody issues. Unless you're okay playing with 250+ ping, AVOID AVOID AOID.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay itself, when actually as intended is pretty fun. Building and combat are both great in this game. What's not so great is the community. It was never huge to begin with, and now it's pretty much dead. Great idea, decent graphics & engine, however what largely killed the community is the fact almost EVERY patch requires a full map wipe. This basically means your literally starting the whole game all over. There are no stats to retain, everything is built up piece-by-piece. This also means if your base is destroyed, you're back to square one.

I've had this game for a while and used to be on a great RP server. Arguable still one of the best gaming experiences I've ever had. The server died as people moved onto other games. Unless you're going to host your own server for you and your friends, your only option is public servers. When I played months ago this meant extreme hackers. Public servers are still terrible and full of Chinese who seem to have nothing better to do than hack a washed up game, or chase you around the map for literally an hour until they can chop off your head.

Played this game again for the first time in 3 months today. The new map is fantastic, the group of Chinese that logged on after I played 8 hours today and hack: 'wall climbed' into my base ( 10+ blocks high) naked with haliberds, killed me several times, didn't ever bother to take my loot, destroyed my bed & crest and are probably still dismantling my base just for ♥♥♥♥♥ as I write this, not so fantastic. Should have heeded the warnings, 30 minutes earlier someone was complaining in global chat about 'wall climbers', asking how it was done, to which I replied 'hacks'....I doubt they'll be returning to RoK either....

Probably won't ever play again, which is a shame, because it had potential. Save your $20.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of kings is a great game to play alone or with friends. It has everything shown in the trailer, and every single feature is a perfectly working. Crafting is simple. You gather wood, stone, metal, etc and make better crafting tables and other crafting items which are simillar to rust's crafting. Game play is absolutly fun, go and become king go around as a midget slaugheting people or just explore. The map is quite empty at the moment but with a large ammount of players there will be alot of raiding to do. With the chivalry-like combat system attacking people is quite fun when you have a small malitia to a large army. I do have to say, the game does not feel like a 20$ game, but it sure is fun. In its state, there are quite a few bugs. They are nothing agnoying  but they can happen at random times. One of the bugs that I found was me getting launched into the air (I think i might have met God) and splashing down into the water. The physics system is pretty good at its state right now. As I said before the flying bug is one of the only problems in the game. The character  customization feels alot like oblivin when you crate the strangest character. It is not that complicated and can edit your characters full body. You can be a averaged joe, or be a giant, or just be a little person. Reign Of Kings is a great game for anyone who just is a casual gammer or just wants to mess around with friends.

I did forget to add that the community is great there are no screaming children, or people who just call you curse words.

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best medieval role playing game I've ever played.  Don't listen to bad review saying the game is stagnant or dying. This game is great and getting better with multiple updates per month.  Rise to take the crown, fight in the kings army,  influence the land from the shadows with politics and deceit, become the realms royal blacksmith, or simply spend your time on a ship fishing the open seas.  You wont find open RP like this anywhere else.  Heres how my first in-game week broke down....

Day 1 - Started as a peasent and crafted a few simple tools from what I could pick up.

Day 2 - Built a small outpost to house my bed and a few wood chests.

Day 3 - Made some freinds and sieged the kings castle.

Day 4 - Took the throne and imposed a small tax on the realm.

Day 5 - Fought off several guilds from our castle walls.

Day 6 - Our walls fell and our reign of terror was ended.

Day 7 - Fished off a peir

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is everything i have always wanted in a game. Although it's still in Early Access state, it is ABSOLUTELY playable! It is a fully functioning game and so far i have yet to find any flaws other than the need for polishing up on cpu/gpu resource management and efficiency. The official servers are overwhelmingly packed but there are plenty of community servers and more show up everyday!
The games world rules are equivalent to what you would expect from a Hardcore PVP minecraft server. Absolutely EVERYTHING is raidable which means no items on the server are 100% safe from being stolen. Yes you can put up measure of protection for your items that will deter almsot anyone from stealing your stuff but if they try hard enough they can get them. When you log out your character starts sleeping on the ground on the spot you logged off leaving him and his inventory exposed to plundering unless you have either a good hiding spot or a nice house with a locked door. Claim the land your home is on and only you will be able to remove or place blocks on it and they will need to make a seige weapon to break in. Seige weapons are expensive and hard to use and leave the user vulnerable to other players sneaking up on them if they are not with a group so rest assured your items should be fairly safe behind locked doors.
Basically you gather supplies, and food which involves hunting animals, foraging berries, chopping down trees, gathering rocks, etc all to make your gear and your base, gather up friends and make allies on the server, join a guild or make a guild, group up and see if you can seize the throne for your own faction! Kind kings who give players guidance and have low taxes are usually supported by the playerbase of the server whereas most kings who come into power and raise the taxes to the roof are short lived when the furry of the whole server rallies up to get their vengence! Tax will literally tax everything you collect or harvest from the map, 50% tax? half the wood and stone you collect is instantly transported to the kings chest. Good kings never raise it above 10% and if your lucky 5%
You can build a bed as a spawn point otherwise you will land on a random location of the map when killed, if you join a different server you start from scratch with new players and a new map.

reviewText:
This was my first survival game, and with that I can say that I had many hours of enjoyment building bases, raiding bases, and roping people while having my team beat them to death.

All that aside, the honest truth is.... It lost its charm with the direction the devs took the game.... It saturated the servers with a gigantic map and more time wasted just seeking people to interact with. I don't want to be anti-social in a game that is supposed to be survival" - that includes surviving other players.

In any case

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Amazing game for the price. Has it all, PvP, Building, RP and Survival. I've been holding off reviewing this game until I've had atleast 500 hours on it.

It's time to review.

Pros

-Some of the funniest gaming experiences I've had have been on this game.

-Building is fun and you can really creative with it, even better than the building system in minecraft.

-PvP - Fast paced and very skill based.

-Roleplaying - Even though I'm orientated towards PvP, Roleplay servers are an entirely differant experience in the game. Putting on a funny medieval voice and catching criminals as the medieval police was a very fun experience.

-Character creation - I still chuckle at the bizzare and ugly character people come up with.

-War time - The King and the guild system really add to the game, go to war with the king or with differant guilds.

Cons

- Don't play this game alone - Whether you get irl friends, steam friends or make friends in game, it just makes the game so much more enjoyable than getting teamed on by yourself by 3 guys.

- Official Server KOS and offline raiding - Although a lot of people like killing on sight and offline raiding, (i'm one of them) a lot of people get fustrated and leave after they die and lose their gear or somebody raids their home. If you're one of these people do not threat, you can still enjoy this game. There are COMMUNITY server with rules and admins who will ban anybody who breaks the rules. Find the right server for you.

- Sieging - Sieging went from being completely overpowered to being completely underpowered. Codehatch are currently working on balancing so in time the siegeing system is a bit unbalanced and it may take a while to break into a base with a trebuchet.

Overall I rate this game a solid 8/10 game. Some balancing issues are needed but overall I am very, very happy with my purchase. Thanks codehatch.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Early Access Launch Day Impressions Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h3KKr1l9hUw

Okay, for the second time now, this is a game that has completely reversed my review from an original 'two thumbs down' review that I posted on it's early access to a positive 'two thumbs up' review just a couple of days later.

Why?

Well, I admitted in my original review that I loved almost everything about this game from the graphics, crafting and even the Kings castle how who controlled the kings throne could set their own tax rate and collect that percentage of taxes on all other players collected resouces.  My problem came with the core of this game on that first day, about my first two hours of game time where the combat experience was laggy and suffered from extremely slow framerates.

Since then and about 20 hours of game time later..  I'm sold that this game is not only a two thumbs up, but the most fun, best multiplayer survival sandbox game out now.  It's incredibly fun, period.  Yes it has bugs and glitches and things that make you scratch your head like deer that run from you and fly through the air against logic and physics.  It doesn't matter.  This game is so much fun that it's easy to overlook these little problems and glitches that make no sense.

Granted, I havent put all those hours in myself, as my son's best friend has been using my account to play with my son these past couple of days.  But both of them agree that this game is loads of fun after going on a five hour adventure in the game just this afternoon.

I will be posting videos on this game soon, because covering everything fun and great about what these developers have created with this would make an insanely long wall of text that few would read.  Let's just say though that if you are an existing fan of similar games like Rust, Seven Days To Die, and the Forest, then you will probably love this game.  I have over 500 hours into Rust, and this game so far offers deeper gameplay, better graphics, and more fun then Rust.

It's not perfect, but it IS a helluva lot of fun, and these developers (who completely missed with StarForge) have both surprised and impressed me with RoK.  My biggest fear and reason to tell people to hold back is my fear that cheaters and hackers might take over and ruin this great game.  But it also might be a good reason to tell people to jump in NOW before that happens and experience all the fun it offers while it lasts.  Maybe the developers will continue to impress me and actually support and make this game even better and be able to control the cheaters and hackers.  {crosses my fingers}

With over 40 hours of game time in already between my son and I, this game has already been worth it's purchase price, and I suspect there are hundreds of hours to come.  The medeival style crafting in this game is already about 10 times that of what Rust 2.0 offers now, and we've only crafted about 15% of everything possible with all the hours we've already played.  ..Awesome.

Any serious fans of Rust should not pass on this one right now.  For Rust fans particularly, this game is a definite and serious MUST-BUY".  Wait
date: unless you are one of those weasel cheating
recommended: hack-using losers from Rust... then you should sat far

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wasn't sure what to think of this game at first view. However after playing it for a total of 1 hour I was hooked and played it for 8 more hours on the first day.

However information was being spread  about the company making the game. They botched on another game and people feel they were ripped of. Inspite of that for twenty dollars, I feel I have gotten my moneys worth easily. I've spent more on games that only have 20 hours of gameplay and very little replay value. However I'm well over 100 hours into this game and I still have not gotten bored.

I do recommend finding a good online community to play with while the game is under development. For me that meant roleplay servers. The players are more friendly and are less likely to just break your stuff while you are asleep or kill you on sight. Plus interacting with other's characters is rather fun. At the time for local interaction VOIP is required. Otherwise there is a global chat for all and a global chat for your guild.

The game is perfect for anyone who loves the idea of playing around in a fantasy world and building their own great castles or even small homes.

As an alpha build, one thing to keep in mind is that servers do get completely wiped from time to time in order to fix issues. This can be discouraging but in a good community the players will work together to help rebuild before going to war with one another.

I have recommended this game to all my friends and those who have purchased it have really enjoyed the game so far. I am looking forward to the future development of the game, but I will never feel that I was ripped off even if it doesn’t get much further than this.

reviewText:
I have played this game since release and absolutely loved it when it in early Alpha. The building and PvP atmosphere was awesome & I was having an ♥♥♥ load of fun playing it. The game is absolutely unplayable right now on a public server.

Last night I logged on, right after a server was wiped, and began establishing myself. I put in about 5 hours and had a very nice setup. A naked man wielding a club shows up and starts throwing spears at my base. Three of us run out to dispatch him, wearing Iron & Leather armor. We all have Iron weapons. This man proceeds to hit me and my friends, with a wooden club, from about 50 ft. away, never missing, & kills all three if us in seconds. He then enters our stone base, which is 100% blocked off with stone block and Iron gates, instantly and camps us. Shortly after, I go run around the corner of the mountain and this same guy has a giant T7 block base. He did this in 3 hours? I was logged on 2 hours b4 he was even on the server.

I can not believe Code}{atch is just letting this game go to ♥♥♥♥. So many people enjoy it and they do literally nothing to combat hacking.  The game has so much potential, but their lack of effort has left it in an unplayable state. I wasted 5 hours of my time last night to rage quit. It is absolutely ridiculous that they have done nothing after all the input they have been given regarding this. Just read the rest of the comments and forums! I would not recommend this game to anyone until a solution is found.

Thank you Code}{atch for ruining what used to be one of my favorite games. Do you not care about your reputation? Or fans of your game? It would appear not.
