reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is great but the servers are bad!
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR AT THE BOTTOM

A good game with potential to be great, Reign of Kings offers an engaging medievel survival experience with a fair amount of depth already while its still in alpha. The game when fully fleshed out, has the potential imo to provide hours upon hours of fun akin to the type of experiences you would find in rust/dayz type communites albeit with less ♥♥♥♥ery. Thats not to say that this game has some flaws (which are to be expected in alpha) so for the sake of lists and lists alone (You know you like pros and cons bullet points in our reviews, you know you do!) I shall provide a brief list of Pros and Cons from MY perspective.

PROS
-Best Character Creation menu EVER!!! (I would seriously pay 5 bucks for a dlc that let me use the same system in this game on ANY game with character creation. Now the reason why I like it is very polarizing but I'll just state it simply; You can make your guy look ♥♥♥♥ing wierd beyond imagination. Remember 2K15's Face Scan Glitch? Picture that but the WHOLE body is your playground, if you haven't seen pictures of what Im talking about just google it and thank me later)
-SUPER SMALL DL for how much stuff is already in the game, when I first dl'ed it was under 1gb (its more or exactly 1gb due to patches last time i checked)
-Fairly Responsive Dev Team (Had one night where we saw 2 patches within a few hours of each other, they were extremly similar in what they fixed but it still shows they are earnest in their attempts to find all the kinks and what not)
-Potential for an awesome RP experience (I suggest private or whitelisted servers, public servers it is nigh impossible to engage in rp or lite rp without sustaining small to severe raids up to having your whole base, blocks and all taken)
-Potential for awesome PVP (Right now the game consists of several classes of swords axes warhammers bows crossbows javelins and varies other trinkets to maim and dismember your prey whether youre going for the kill or just to break his legs so you can rope him up easily and take him to your happy shack, and yes you will make a happy shack as I like to call it this game, filled with all the torture devices you can need for catching a leatherclad theif nicking your ♥♥♥♥. Also you can parry and feint and use 3 different types of strike for each melee weapon. SOMEWHAT similar to M&B or Chivalry)
-Potential for amazing buildings (Has no upper limit to building as far as I know, built a tower on one server so high we timed it at 33 seconds to impact when jumping from the top. You can on rp servers mostly, build large complex towns through proper coordination and what not.)
-Fairly engaging soundtrack (The soundtrack is very similar at somepoints to Skyrim the only problem being it plays sporadically at what seems to be random intervals, sometimes I hear music every 30 mins, sometimes its 10, sometimes it 2 hours etc.)

CONS
-Public servers can become riddled with hackers and griefers and even community servers that are not password protected or require you to be whitelisted can fall prey to these jackasses.
-Limited material and structures to build with. (7 Tiers of material to make your base out of ranging anywhere from thatch,wood, reinforced iron, and stone being the highest tier currently. Also unless you rotate stairs or ramps there is no way to round out structures without resorting to the previous mentioned method, which is time consuming and often fatal if you are building high up. The game has half a dozen or so different lights, lanterns, lamps, candles, and torches to choose from when lighting up your humble viking raiding camp or peaceful cooking village. There are a handful of crafting stations each with there own set of upgrades that can produce anything from crests to claim land, steel armor for your warriors to defend their holy god emperor king lord, all manner of weapons, lockpicks, ropes, shackles, whips, trebuchets etc. The torture stations they have in the game are fairly limited so far but extremley rewarding when you do manage to throw someone in one, they consist of fun toys like guillotines, pillorys, gallows etc. There is A LOT of stuff for such a small DL and for an early release as well so I won't list them all.)
-Unbalanced PVP (Right now most servers consist of midget fetus monsters with t rex arms running around with weapons twice the size of them kneecapping everyone of normal stature and just being an all around menace because, although the headshots are easier to score on these berserker offspring of the midget king napoleon, thats ONLY if you can hit the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Not to mention hitboxes are horrible in this game compounded with lag and the to be expected bugs from alpha makes most matches a toss up, even if you're decked out in steel you can find yourself beaten to death and dismemberd by man in a thong wielding a deer leg.)
-Server rollbacks/crashes can set your charcter back 2 mins or a few hours, I've had friends say it set them back by a full day but I cannot confirm that)
-Game in its current state can become somewhat repetitive without engaging PVP/RP (After 50 hours in and being the king on a server where we built a nigh impenetrable gate, I found myself envying the peasants me and my men tortured and harassed for so long, manually collecting taxes or leading werewolfs or bears into their open houses, making them fight in death pits etc, because I was trapped in this iron fortress which is really just a giant guy made of stone who appears to be knighting another giant guy made of stone, while the wretched little curs were free to roam the countryside picking flax and flowers or blowing obnoxiously on their wretched horns or flutes, I had to always be on my guard leaving my fortress for as King you were always a target. So I switched servers and started and savage camp with my friends where we only wore wooden armor and used javelins and bows and shouted incomprehensible phrases at passerby before savagely...well savaging them. I suggest whenever you're feeling tired with the game to switch servers or just rebuild your base under a theme like vikings
recommended: or slavers" whatever! just to keep you in the game until the devs start pumping out the really good stuff\n-The land is extremly small
hoursPlayed: to run from one end to the other takes about 7 mins so if you're coming from jogging simulator I mean DayZ then you might be put off or find this to your liking
voteText: hopefully they expand and add more stactic objects and possibly NPCS to interact with. Maybe a safe zone to do trading who knows.)\nTL;DR\nThis game has the potential to thrust itself firmly into the upper echelons of survival base building type games
helpfulPercent: but that all depends on the devs and their ability to push out fun and challenging new content and get rid of the hackers while also allowing a way for players to moderately their own communities without need of an Admin on 24/7. They also need to desperately update the admin panel because as it stands right now with explosive kegs being disabled
votesHelpful: admin have no reliable way of removing objects or blocks placed down to grief someone other then using a trebuchet like a normal player. With all that being said this purchase should give you a few hundred hours if you're into medievel ♥♥♥♥

A game the devs will probably bail out on, insanely unbalanced items. you can literally take down a clan of 20 people with full steel armor and trebs with a rope.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I bought this game in early alpha it was great fun. I started on a server with a low amount of players and some became addicted to the game. Bashing trees, building towers, killing animals ( I said I'd take revenge you stupid bear! ), some pvp from time to time and even starting a guild.

In the early alpha it was pretty easy to go from noob to hero, I didnt mind that at all since everytime you go offline for longer then 3 days you've got to pretty much restart and re-do everything. I had a great time and had a little guild with some new friends I made. But the fun decreased every update, restarting from the bottom became harder and harder until it was nearly impossible to get starting on your own. This game is fun, but the amount of time it takes to start and get into the fun stuff takes too long and everytime you get close someone will beat you up and make you have to restart all over again. But this isnt the only bad thing, there are tons of little glitches, sometimes they even kill you!!
The PvP is very very laggy, its so laggy that its not skill based whenever you win, nope its based on the amount of lagg and luck you get.

I honestly was looking forward to play this game, but after all these things,
I'm not enjoying the game anymore.
Too bad it had to end like this.

reviewText:
This game had great potential, and I think that I gave it a fair shake. However, it was abandoned by devs, who I believe have only done token updates, especially considering how this game was exactly how I remembered it a year ago when I first bought it, with maybe some graphics updates.

It's still what it sounds like at a core, but with massive problems, listed below:
-Massive lag spikes everytime someone leaves or joins the server.
-The server seems to sync itself withg the individuals, making it so if you are around anyone with a bad ping, your lag will increase tenfold
-Everyone is a murderer. Everyone. Be prepared to lose everything to somoene who has been playing for a day longer than you.
-Hacking is rampant. Admins are gone from offiicial servers, and you have to play by the rules of whatever private server you are joining if you want enforcement.
-I played for 4 hours in order to get a bow and some arrows. I was waiting in lag for 1 of those hours, just to open the crafting menu.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A quick pre review note: I've been called a whiner for complaining about this game. But let me just say that I LOVE survival games. I play 7 Days to Die and Space Engineers pretty much exclusively so I know what I'm talking about when I say this game is just freakin awful.

Here are my main problems with the game (compared to other survival games I enjoy past and present):

The UI is hideous, the game is buggy, the servers are full of angry 12 year olds, the graphics are nasty, the controls are clunky, the armor might as well be made of paper, the enemies are over powered, player movement speed is super slow, you can get roped by a naked guy and hauled off to stocks and there is NOTHING YOU CAN DO!

Read on for review and updates...




<August Update>

New update, Thought I'd try again. Still awful. In fact worse. A naked guy was able to grab me with a rope from real far away and haul me for ages while I could do nothing. He put me in stocks and axed me to death. I respawned, tried to find him and got teleported back to the same stocks some how. I could swing my club but not access my inventory. Only option was to exit game... What a pile of ♥♥♥♥ this game is.

11/10 would get murdered by an angry 12 year old again

<End of August Update>




<July Update>

Another month gone by, and it seems like nothing has changed. I can't believe this piece of junk even exists! It was gifted to me by a friend but I still feel robbed...

<End of July Update>




<June Update>

Updated review to reflect recent updates. It's still bad and the fact there nearly every update (usually weekly) means a server reset and losing everything you've worked on really annoys me.

Buggy, bad graphics, horrible community. The only good" thing about this game is the concept. It's executed extremely poorly.

Wait for full release and it MIGHT be stable enough to play and enjoy.

<End of June Update>




<Original review May 2015>

I wish I kept my original review... Went into great detail about the bugs. Needless to say
date: DON'T BUY THIS GAME!\n\n<End of original review>"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start with what is likely a great disservice to the game, but something I think needs to be said early.

This game is okay if you like the basic concept, but it is really only as good as the folks you play it with.

There is a great deal of depth for what is essentially Rust with a much more in-depth crafting system.  The UI shares a lot in common with that other game, and the general resource gathering aspect will feel very familiar to those that have played both.

But that is where the comparison ends.

I was hesitant to jump in on this one as I had played both flavors of that other game, and a few others games like it, and was expecting the same general type of community.  I'm not going to lie, yes, you'll encounter a few of those folks here as well, but the sheer scope of this game and the community at large, to me, more than makes up for any aspects of PVP that may have you not wanting to jump in on this one.

Building crafting is a free formed cubed" based with multiple material types and a is a tiered progression tied to your crafting equipment (workstations).  As you improve those workstations
date: you gain access to better stuff to make
recommended: very straight forward and simple to get started in.\n\nEarly game is about survival
voteText: and all of it builds up to trying to take (or defend) the crown for the kingdom.\n\nWhile yes
helpfulPercent: you'll run into those folks who simply want to watch the world burn
votesHelpful: you'll also encounter those who want to achieve something more
votesTotal: and this game allows both to reside mostly side-by-side
votesFunny: while allowing you the convenience to play (mostly) how you like.\n\nJust keep in mind
commentsCount: at its heart
column16: this is a PVP game that is really focused on the group vs. group mechanics
column17: and there is no solo player mode without hosting your own private server.  So you can play solo if you really want
column18: but you're honestly missing out on more than 50% of the game doing so."
column19: March 23, 2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far my $20 has been well spent.  I joined a couple of Community servers to start out, and every time would gather/harvest peacefully for 30m or so.  Then I would run into someone and get KoS.

Out of frustration I bought a server, made it PvE and advertised as noob-friendly, and now we have a nice friendly server where KoS is not an issue.  True, we have crazies that like to come in and rampage (PvE isn't implemented correctly as it is still possible to kill others) but hey, that's why they invented the blacklist!

Everyone appreciates being able to log into a brand-new Alpha game and learn the ropes without being whipped in the stockade within 10 minutes.  As the regular server members evolve in their gameplay, KoS won't be such an issue because they will be better equipped to deal with crazy randoms.

10/10 would buy a noob-friendly server again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best survival game since the original Rust.  Very close to being better with some slight improvements in glitches/performance, the sort of thing youd expect in early access.

However, dont waste your time doing anything other than logging in and having a walk around the map to see what others have done.. any time you spend building, crafting or role playing WILL be wasted when hackers fly through you and grief hours of work.  I've had significant bases and games on 3 servers and have left a dozen others, all due to hacking and admin abuse.

If you have a private server with plenty of friends to play on, then do that, otherwise the game is a waste of time.

Best 6 days of gameplay I've had in a long time, doubt I'll put it on again until I read the games fixed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok firstly I love this game but at present, in good concience I just cant recommend it. Like the early days of RUST, the hacker problem is currently completely out of control, going to such extremes that not only can they fly but teleport everyone on the server, spawn stuff, wipe everyones inventory on the server... and I'm talking about official servers here!!

Just today Everyone on the official server  I was on had their inventorys wiped twice. Apart from the hacker problem there seems to be constant issues with Rollbacks and crashes that just kick everyone off the server.

Apart from its huge problems with teh forementioned the game its self is incredibly fun.

If they fix the server problems and teh hacker problems (which may very well be the same thing) then this game will be good.  I kind of consider it a shame that they did a steam release while such serious problems were still going on because all that ever happens when developers do that is they lose a crap load of credibility and their game gets largely written off by the steam community even if they do fix it.

The early access thing in its current form needs to stop really or at least there needs to be a minimum standard of security/stability which is enforced by Valve.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've had the game for a week now now and was so impressed with the potential of the gameplay that i bought the game and after a few days set up a dedicated server that has become very popular.

This is probably more pre-alpha than alpha.
The actual content already in the game is good enough to create enough objects to make decent castles and an array of weapons that can be used to siege each others castles. The crafting system is basic but working
Graphically it is pleasant.
The world is big enough to cater for a good few players
Unfortunately the optimisation as it stands now will only allow for around 35 players on a decent Zeon\I7 based server

As can be expected at such an early stage of development  it has bugs, there are obvious massive holes to be plugged in GUI, admin tools, server logging etc and little if any thought seems to have gone into how the game would be played by the masses.

Suprisingly though their are few Major game breaking bugs. The majority of problems are caused by kids with limited knowledge decompiling the code and then rewriting it to use in cheeting.
If you were to consider trying the game in its present state, then you need to stay away from the public servers or run your own server connecting via localhost

Unfortunately I see a major downside to the development of this game.
The game is being developed by the following 2 men
http://www.codehatch.com/vision.html

They have limited experience in game development and are quick to censor posts they disagree with
From their youthful appearance and the fact they they already dropped their Starforge project and their inability to take advice from those more experienced the Gold Mine they have created is likely to collapse.

They need professional help to get the fundamentals in place. I have a feeling they wont accept that and as with their previous project they will drop it
Shame really

There is no official website, no official forums and no bug tracker.  REALLY!!!!  Yes

Best approach here would be when they drop the project, turn it into an open source project and let it develop and achieve its true opotential

People whom have a sour taste in their mouth from Starforge is understandable, but you must greet new games with open arms and not distatse before you get to know the game.  To Enjoy this game fully Play as a group on a decent populated server and it becomes tons of fun to enjoy :).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First 5 minutes of gameplay.

>Spawn on beach.
>Walk around beach.
>Find bag with loot in it on the beach within minutes.
>Get a few upgrades.
>Start chopping down tree with a bone axe I found.
>Suddenly an invisible hacker with an axe (I could only see the axe in his hand) starts wailing on me, hitting me each time until I die.
>That was my first 5 minutes of gameplay.

I realized going into this there would be hackers. I knew good and well what I was getting myself into. But when I log in and I'm immediately dropped by a hacker then there's problems. I'm still going to give this game a chance still but in it's current state I suggest NOT buying this game for a few weeks or months. At least until this game's security against hackers is improved a ton. Don't let your opinion of this game get too warped before it even has a chance to grow just because some manchild decided he's going to try and stop yet another survival game from being able to progress in a healthy manner.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has great potential.  Like a lot of failed Alpha games do.  Playstyle is also pretty fun, although damned tedious if you are trying to solo play or have a small group.  All of this could be overcome, except for the stupid hacking and exploiting taking place on 5 of 5 servers I playtested on.  As it stands, this game sucks.  It simply isnt acceptable to spend a few hours collecting to have hackers show up invis, with freeze capability, who kill you and move on.  Or who blow through your walls with one hit.  Or who fly around.  Developers made a game with absolutely no plan to deal with hackers, that all is being attempted now, with sad and sorry results.  It was so bad on all the servers I tried, I requested a refund from steam for the game because it is simply not playable as is.  I will take a look again in a few months to see if things are better.  We shall see.
Reaper

reviewText:
Early Access Review

RoK is a great concept and actually a very fun game at its core but it is currently riddled with exploits, bugs, and an incompetent development team who have a very shady past with their first title, Starforge.

The game gives you the freedom of Minecraft building with Chivalry-style medieval combat, although a little rough around the edges. The ability to free-build a castle and risk losing it all provides hours of fun. This fun has been RUINED by an influx of Chinese players who lag, exploit, and hack the North American official servers day and night, driving the legitimate players away.

CodeHatch have failed to acknowledge this as even a problem and CHOOSE to develop the game in ways that it doesn't need right now. They chose to spend almost a month designing shields instead of pouring all their resources into releasing a working ping-limiter and auto-kicker system to get rid of these lagging and cheating Asian players. The game actually is more broken with this latest Patch 18 than it was weeks ago. CodeHatch continuously claims that the ping-limiter is not quite ready yet and delays its release every passing update. 99% of their community forums are actual LEGIT players begging for them to fix this...yet they can't/won't do it.

DON'T get sucked in by the 50% off - Let them earn players by releasing content that helps the game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is in a playable state that is fun, but there are issues that need to be addressed. The combat is not great, it needs major improvements. The combat does not feel like anything from chivalry, there is a lot of lag and little combat. Currently right now simply sprinting into some can kill them... On servers with low ping I still see a lot of dsync happen. Players are not where they are on others screens and doors are open for one but closed for another. Also this games runs poorly on a lot of the official servers, once you start building a base your frames will drop, my guild had an average of 15 fps inside our base. Not only does building drop your frames but some servers just can't handle the load of people and the fps drops everywhere. Hackers are also starting to become a problem, today I logged on and died in full armor by one hit from a new spawn, If this game wasn't funny I would not play it becaue once the humor runs out you are left with a buggy and boring expierience.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Extremely buggy.

Here's my experience so far.

Log into server. While im looking at loading screen, i hear stabbing & dying, when game finally loads R.I.P

Apparently someone stabbed me to death while i was logging in?

Okay, fine respawn then.

Oh, now i cant move.

Oh well log off & try another server.

Log into another server. Spawn in the middle of the night, get chased by wolves, run for dear life, as soon as i lose the wolves, the game coughs (literally) and im stuck in place.

Guess ill try a couple more times before i give up on this game. Good thing theres plenty of servers!

Edit: A patch and a half later & its still pretty broken. Again I was killed before the game loaded, and again i was stuck in place on respawn.

I do like the premise, and i hope this game is playable someday.

That day has not yet arrived.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reign of Kings is a medieval multiplayer sandbox with rich crafting (smelting, foraging, building and hunting.),
a survival of the fittest will you Make your own base to fend off the creatures players,
will you fight to be king to Show your gentle or violent heart off as you rule the kingdom,
leaving your reign amongst the people,
with the base combat system of Chivalry Medieval.

There's so much rp from the community servers no Kos no random grabbing people with rope and running off,
The Kings somtimes make there own rules Like a market no one can or is allowed to kill inside of it and players can make a shop to trade resources so if people live near iron and others live near oil they could trade it.

RoK (Reign of Kings) is Like many games combined together, Life is Feudal : Your own, Chivalry Medieval, Mount and Blade warband, Minecraft, Rust and many more games.

If you like the the Medieval side the PvP side the raid other peoples bases side the Building hunting or any other side,
then I Recommend this game to you.

reviewText:
Where do I begin?

I was the owner Lost Chapters UK/EU roleplay server, I did my best to create an engaging community with events, factions, titles, unique rules for war, but at the end of all that It was completely ruined by hackers, they would destroy a weeks work in an hour, people would leave, I would have to waste time giving back items instead of roleplaying, in the end it just became a hack fest, no matter how many moderators or admins, they still got in.

Code Hatch is probably one of the worst game developers of the current century, in terms of customer support, community support, game development, game design, game opitimization.

I enjoyed this game when it first released because I never heard of Code Hatch before and expected the game to eventually be supported with map creator tools and modding tools, boats, horses, currency systems.. tools for a roleplay community set in the medieval world, none of this happened.

I'm afraid after coming back once again the Lost Chapters gang of people will be leaving forever and migrate to Life Is Fuedal or another medieval roleplay game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you're looking for an alternative to Rust, this is your game. Although I am usually against purchasing Early Access games, I couldn't resist this one. The crafting is incredibly in depth and you can most definitely survive as a new spawn quite easily. Character customization is hilarious considering what you can do you them (i.e huge jacked legs w/ T-rex arms).

My one issue with this game is that it was made by the same people who kickstarted their first game Starforge" on IndieGoGo quite a few years ago. They've pretty much abandoned that game and are "officially releasing" it soon dispite it clearly not being done. I did however contact them regarding this concern and they offered to refund the initial purchase of Starforge (although I declined) and gave me an extra RoK key.

Personally
date: this game is worth the purchase despite it being Early Access. They are updating the game regularly
hoursPlayed:
and the game is genuinely a fun time. To rap it up here's the review:

PROS:

- Character Customization usually results in tons of laughs
- In depth crating system
- Progession does not feel forced or grindy
- Customer service/ Support are very cooperative when voicing concern with their previous game

CONS:

- Made by the same people who never finished their IndieGoGo campaign "StarForge"
- Hackers are rampant
- No incentive to not KoS
- Server Stability is terrible right now"

reviewText:
Where do I begin?

I was the owner Lost Chapters UK/EU roleplay server, I did my best to create an engaging community with events, factions, titles, unique rules for war, but at the end of all that It was completely ruined by hackers, they would destroy a weeks work in an hour, people would leave, I would have to waste time giving back items instead of roleplaying, in the end it just became a hack fest, no matter how many moderators or admins, they still got in.

Code Hatch is probably one of the worst game developers of the current century, in terms of customer support, community support, game development, game design, game opitimization.

I enjoyed this game when it first released because I never heard of Code Hatch before and expected the game to eventually be supported with map creator tools and modding tools, boats, horses, currency systems.. tools for a roleplay community set in the medieval world, none of this happened.

I'm afraid after coming back once again the Lost Chapters gang of people will be leaving forever and migrate to Life Is Fuedal or another medieval roleplay game.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do you feel the need for a lobotomy? Buy Reign of Kings.

This tire-fire of a game is truly one of the most horrific, poorly thought out, ill conceived, astonishingly poorly executed games on steam. My buddies convinced me to buy this game when it first came out as alpha. Since survival games were the rage of 2015, and having had some fun with others, I felt I'd give it a try (Day Z, H1Z1 -- which are not even close to great games, but at least were fun for a bit).

Literally would have enjoyed burning a 20 dollar bill in my hand. I know that is usually a hyperbolic statement, but, seriously, that would have been more enjoyable than giving a cent to this game and its creators.

From the beggining:
-The worst hit boxes in any video game I have ever played. Ever. Spears stick out of enemies feet from their bodies, but if you swing a club at an enemy and it visible goes through them, guess what? You missed. Learning this defunct combat system is akin to learning sandskrit.... blindfolded.

-If you like a gaming community rife with hackers, this is your game. The amount of hacking ingame makes H1Z1's hacking woahs seem like childsplay. Seriously, your base will be hacked by time you finish heating up that Hot-Pocket.

-The doors. Oh, for the love of God, the doors. I @#$% you not, the doors, when closing them, will pull you back into your structure and lock you inside. It is a @$#%^%^@# artform to close those doors. If the secret to immortality and infinite wealth was behind a reign of kings door, you'd die young and poor.

-Even if your base isn't hacked, don't worry, they are unimagineably easy to break into and have everything stolen from them. But let's be real, it was likely just hacked.

-Did I mention the combat? Oh, I did? It is so @#$%@!% terrible it needs a second mention how bad it is.

LAST BUT NOT LEAST:
I tried loading this game to see if this s!@# storm of a game had any improvements made on it. As if I could salvage the 29.4 hours i wasted on this game, and maybe get some value.

Nope.

Blue Screened my computer upon load.

Do Not Buy Reign of Kings. I promise. I guarantee. I ensure. You will regret it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhen I first looked into this game, I had thought that it would immense fun. I love high fantasy games but this one is a disappointment even with my positively biased views for Medieval games. The servers and connection between player and server is a huge problem. Not only that but if there is only just a single person on the server with you, lag jumps through the roof and will most often end up just logging you saying no connection to server. Now as for game mechanics, I would absolutely love to write a review for that however all my time in this game has been trying to at least get on a server without having a ♥♥♥♥ connection. I wish I could have a refund however the time limit expired months ago. Now im just stuck with an unplayable game in my library.

the bulk of the private servers were filled with countless abusive admins. Just another feather in the cap that helped break this game to virtually zero. That's why the mass majority of us went to other and much more better survival style games such as ARK and 7DtD.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is really inviting and easy to figure out, I can spend hours on and just build and farm materials with the occasional bypasser who greets me (kos mostly if not on closed server) and who might just offer a RP session of a lifetime.

The most fun i get out of this game is when my guild has made a beautiful base filled with equipment and resources, and we head out in search of adventure and combat. Some servers have built a small comunity with arenas, inns, battlegrounds, churces and whatever you could think of, the oppurtunities are endless.

The combat system is pretty easy to figure out, but harder to get skilled at so just practice and you'll get there.

The build system is ok, items that are hard to place and take to much space, the point and click is uncomfortable and almost impossible at certain angles. But i guess its a work in progress.

My Score

Gameplay : 8/10
Video : 5/10
Audio : 4/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI want to recommend this game. But I can't. It has a lot of great features that i'm not even going to cover because there is no point in doing so. It's another crafting game that puts way too much emphasis on focusing people into a PvP situation. Want to build a base that looks like awsome fortress? Ok. Go ahead and pour hours into this game trying to do so and you will be rewarded with defeat in the end. Whether your structures are big or small someone will want to break it, and this usually will happen while you are logged out and your character is asleep with gear on its person in said base. Oh that's right, you log out and your avatar will be lying there waiting for someone to just beat it into a bloody mess and take all your gear. reviewText:
This game is good but its bad at the same time. Its so bad its good, like those crappy B-Rated horror movies like Sharknado that people will go out of their way to watch with a group of friends. I've dicked around quite a bit in this game and have had a massive amount of fun playing the jenky-game with my friends. The early access glitchy-ness was appealing. But, I'm going to rate this negitively because of one key aspect:

This is it. The game is finished as it is.

I supported this game until Code}{atch, the developer, once again abandoned a project mid-way through. I bought this in beta a while back, expecting a lot more to come of the game. A friend of mine made a brilliant point I couldn't tell if this was a glitch or a feature of the game" and that essentially describes a lot of the poor mechanics of the gameplay. This wouldn't be a problem but the developer decided that
recommended: it was time to release the game in full! So this is it. This is the entire game in all of its (glory?). I wouldn't reccomend it. Its on sale for $4.99 and it isn't even worth that much content-wise. There's NOTHING in this game. Its in dire need of being updated and unfortunately it just won't really happen at this point.\n\nNot to mention the fact that they didn't even incorperate region-locking for the online servers
hoursPlayed: so there are massive amounts of vigilante chinese-hackers ruining servers so average players like me can't function properly and play the game the way its supposed to be played. reviewText: I've played this game for quite a while, stopped and started again quite a few times, co-owned a popular server, experienced almost every aspect of the game, and while a lot of this game has charm and serves a purpose to those that love medieval themed games. The overall execution of the game is terrible, I recently came back from months of not playing after they stopped adding features to the game, in the hopes that the optimization of the game would have improved. Sadly however, I returned to the same old unfinished game, the game that let me down from such a promising start. The lag on official and community servers is unbearable in combat. On community servers, PvP usually lags when a lot of people are online, which is supposed to be a time when the game is most exciting. The game is overall, pretty terrible, and the company should honestly stop making games until they learn what finishing and perfecting a game actually means.

reviewText:
I cant recommend you play this game in its current state.
If you choose to play it otherwise I will give reasons why you might want too.

-Cons-
1. The game has very bad issues that cause constant server lag as well as constant teleporting issues where you someone will disapear and just reapear somwhere in that area. Since there are heavy lag issues server counts are usally small.
2. The updates come few and far apart with very little changes.
3. Poor optimization and play ability. Even tho the game is not graphicly intensive it runs poorly on all machines.
4. Hitboxes are poorly defined. Manytimes you will go into an engagement and loose not because lack of skill but lack of solid pvp mechanics.
5. The devs have a negative veiw in the public.

-Pros-
1. You like Medieval games.
2. You like building.
3. Decent sound track.(some songs/themes are really good.)
4. The maps are not too large and not to small.
5. The game has allot of potential.

-Conclusion-
Reign Of Kings (RoK) is a good concept lacking proper execution.
It does have allot of potential that I hope will one day be realized.
What is there doesnt justify the costs tho.
I fear without proper direction and changes
this game is going to fall short of community expectations.

-Warning-
I suggest all people throughly withold purchasing an early acess title until they have done research on the devs and there team working on a game at the bare minimum. Too many people are supporting bad business practices.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, thank you for building up such an entertaining and great game.

As a gamer the most important aspect of a game is playability" and if it has this
date: it will have a long-lasting play time.\n\nThe good things about the game are
recommended: it has lots of things similar to our life. There are lots of stuff and things to make. Building part is really nice since it provides the player a wide range of materials and creativity. The voice and mic thing is really nice for Role Playing.\n\nHowever
hoursPlayed: there are too many parts in game to be improved for stable playability. For instance
voteText: at first
helpfulPercent: it is not so much important to have so much items and so much graphics. In alpha version
votesHelpful: the game could be more suitable for older computers (which I have one right now) so that more players can join and test the game without lagging and "paralyzed-screens"
votesTotal: and freezings etc. What I mean is that the game MUST be fluent to play. This is the most important thing for many gamers. The graphics can be altered and improved later on.\n\nSecondly
votesFunny: the very first thing to improve is to OPTIMIZE the game engine as soon as possible. There must be more graphical options (Medium textures i.e.). Additionally the game takes too much RAM to run
commentsCount: so this must be
column17:
fixed at the very beginnig.

I also played ROK in a more advanced computer (My brother's computer and he also has the game) but the problems are nearly the same.

To conclude
column18: the game engine MUST be optimized so that the game can run on most of the computers (even in the older ones). This will make your game suitable for the top numbers (players). And there can be more options in character creation screen. But this is not so necessary for now.\n\nI think this game will start a new era for "free-world type" games and when those improvements above are done
column19: it will reach a wide number of players around the world. In my country
column20: Turkey
column21:
I heard about the same complaints from many players. So your team should focus on the optimization.

In the future if any help needed for "Localization" ( I mean if you need Turkish Language option) I gladly help you with this.

Looking forward to see most of the problems solved in BETA!

LATEST NOTE: The game is open for hacking. So this MUST be fixed at very first so that players do not leave the game FOREVER.

Regards"

Try to remember where I died...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At it's current state, I say wait for it to grow. But it can still be fun and there are many glitches.

Pro's
Good Graphics
Good crafting system
Good building system
PvP
Capturing O_O

Con's
Very laggy at times. (For example, opening up your inventory, then closing it, it lags alot) I even set my graphics to minimum
Takes very long to cook stuff
Hackers/exploiters
Glitches


Suggestions
Single Player mode. where you can choose between survival and creative (Kind of like Minecraft)
King and Queen
Be able to be in multiple guilds at once on a server
Passive mode? (Like in GTA Online)
Shorter cooking time
ALOT shorter time to get water out of well. It takes like an hour
Fix where the bandage heals Hunger and Thirst damage..... ???

That's all I got for now.
